# Employee Welfare

The Company consistently seeks to pay attention to employee welfare and motivate employees by providing fair remuneration to support each employee in contributing their best with optimal work results and loyalty towards the Company.

The Company seeks to ensure that all policies implemented are in line with government regulations related to employee welfare. One concrete action taken is to ensure that the lowest wages given to entry-level employees are not lower than the established minimum wage, to provide a decent living for every employee.

The Company provides various forms of direct financial compensation (such as basic salary, fixed allowances, and bonuses), indirect financial compensation (such as coverage for

iuran BPJS Kesehatan), dan kompensasi non keuangan (seperti pemberian jam kerja fleksibel dan susana cantor yang aman dan nyaman). Kompensasi ini diberikan untuk memberikan keseimbangan kebutuhan financial dan kesejahteraan emotional serta fisik karyawan.

Penentuan remunerasi kanyakan dilakukan dengan mempertimbangkan kemampuan, keterampilan, pendidikan, tanggung jawab dan kompleksitas jabatan, kualifikasi individual, Hasan penilaian kinerja, kondisi相对较 tenaga kerja, dan kondisi Perseroan dan entitas anak. Perseroan juga menyediakan berbagaifasilitas dan tunjangan tambahan lainnya bagi kanyakan yang berhak,seperti tunjangan kesehatan, tunjangan komunikasi, dan tunjangan kendaraaan bagi kanyakan level tertentu.

BPJS Health contributions), and non-financial compensation (such as offering flexible working hours and a safe and comfortable office environment). This compensation is provided to balance the financial needs and the emotional and physical well-being of employees.

The determination of employee remuneration is carried out by considering abilities, skills, education, responsibilities and job complexity, individual qualifications, performance appraisal results, labor market conditions, and the conditions of the Company and its subsidiaries. The Company also provides various facilities and additional benefits for eligible employees, such as health allowances, communication allowances, and vehicle allowances for certain employee levels.

# Hubungan Industrial

Perseroan senantiasa berupaya membrina hubungan industrial yang harmonis dan saling menguntungkan dengan semua pihak terkait, termasukkaryawan, pemasok, konsumen, pemerintah, dan masyarakat. Perseroan Berkomitmen untuk melindungi hak dan kepentungan pihak terkait dan segera menyelesaikan permasalahan secara musyawarah, dengan mengutamakan prinsip-prinsip hubungan industrial, yaitu kepentungan bersama, kemitraan yang menguntungkan, hubungan fungssional dan pembagian tugas, kekuargaan, dan peningkatan produktivitas dan kesejahteraan bersama.

Sebagai bagian dari komitmen terhadap hak karyawan, Perseroan dan entitas anak memberikan kesempatan bagi karyawan membrutuk serikat pekerja untuk berserikat, Berkumpul, dan mengemukakan pendapat sesuai dengan hukum dan peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlaku sebagai pentuk pemberian hak berserikat bagi karyawan.

Perseroan juga memberikan(Beberapa akses alternatif lain kepada kanyakuan untuk mencampaikan saran, kritik, keluhan, masalah dan/ ata laporan indikasi pelanggaran secara musyawarah melalui:

# Industrial Relations

The Company consistently seeks to foster harmonious and mutually beneficial industrial relations with all relevant parties, including employees, suppliers, consumers, government, and the community. The Company is committed to protecting the rights and interests of stakeholders and promptly resolving issues through deliberation, prioritizing the principles of industrial relations, namely mutual interests, beneficial partnerships, functional relationships and division of tasks, kinship, and the enhancement of productivity and mutual prosperity.

As part of the commitment to employee rights, the Company and its subsidiaries provide opportunities for employees to form labor unions to associate, gather, and express opinions in accordance with the prevailing laws and regulations in Indonesia as a form of granting the right of association for employees.

The Company also provides several alternative accesses for employees to submit suggestions, criticisms, complaints, problems, and/or reports on indications of violations by deliberation through:

Supervisor/department head/division head  
Head of the HR Department, in case the problem cannot be solved by the supervisor/department head/division head  
Whistleblowing system

In the event that the problem cannot be resolved by deliberation, the settlement of the problem will be carried out through the procedures as regulated in the applicable laws and regulations.

In 2024, there was no industrial relations dispute in the Company.

# 4. ANALISIS DAN PEMBAHASAN MANAJEMEN MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS

# Tinjauan Industri, Prospek Usaha, dan Strategi Perseroan

Industry Review, Business Outlook, and the Company's Strategy

Dunia—asim的话语 of the new world, which is a combination of the two. In 2024, Duna wasih menghadapi tantangan untuk dada tahun 2024 akibat mencapatanya tensi geopolitik di berbagai kawasan. Invasi Rusia ke Ukraine, konflik Tiongkok-Taiwan, perang Palestina-Israel, serta ketegangan di sejumlah wilayah lain menimbulkan ketidakstabilan bagi相对较 global. Hal ini memperlambat laju pertumbuhan ekonomi dunia dan menyebabkan perekonomian dunia, berdasarkan perkiraan IMF, oleh tumbuh sebesar  $3.2\%$  pada 2024.

Meskipun memiliki peluang pemulihan, kondisi perekonomian dunia tahun 2025 diperkirakan makeshift akan dipenuhi dengan ketidakpastian. Seiring dengan meredanya inflasi,unjumlah bank sentral dunia berpotensi melonggarkan kebjikan dan memberikan ruang bagi likuiditas yang lebih,isar.Namun demikian, dinamika geopolitik, perubahan iklim yang semakin nyata, dan kebjikan protekSIONis dari negara tertentu dapat memperburuk ketidakstabilan ekonomi, memicup penurunan permintaan global, dan perubahan dalam rantai pasokan internasional. IMF memperkirakan(pergerakan perekonomian dunia berada pada kisaran  $3,3\%$  pada tahun 2025,dengan ekonomi negara-negara Berkembang,sebagai penyumbang  $60\%$  pertumbuhan ekonomi global, diperkirakan akan mengalami tekanan.

Berbeda dengan kondisi global, selama tahun 2024, pemerintah Indonesia berhasil menjaga momentum pemulihan, sehingga perekonomian Indonesia tetap dapat tumbuh dengan stabil pada tahun 2024. Berdasarkan data Badan Pusat Statistik, neraca perdagangan Indonesia mengalami surplus sebesar USD 31,04 miliar dollar Amerika Serikat, lebih rendah dibandingkan surplus tahun 2023 yang mencapai USD 36,9 miliar. Didorong oleh penguatan konsumsi domestik, pemulihan sektor industri, serta peningkatan investasi asing, Indonesia mampu mempertahankan laju pertumbuhan ekonomi sebesar  $5.03\%$  ,dengan tingkat inflasi terkendali di level  $1.57\%$  y-o-y, dan nilai tukar Rupiah ditutup pada level Rp16.162/USD pada akhir bulan Desember 2024.

Berlanjutnya ketidakpASTian global dan fluktuasiinya komoditas dapat memengaruhi stabilitas ekonomi Indonesia di tahun 2025. Namun, dengan kebikan fiskal yang hati-hati dan reformasi yang terus berlanjut, Indonesia diharapkan dapat mengukir pertumbuhan yang sudah tingguh di tengah dinamika ekonomi global yang penuh tantangan. Bank Indonesia memerkitaran perekonomian Indonesia dapat memasuki fase pemulihan yang lebih solid pada tahun 2025, dengan laju pertumbuhan sebesar  $4.7\% - 5.5\%$ . Sektor tekologi,

The world still faces significant challenges in 2024 due to rising geopolitical tensions in various regions. Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the China-Taiwan conflict, the Palestine-Israel war, and tensions in many other regions have caused instability in the global market. This slows down the global economic growth rate and causes the world economy, based on estimate of IMF, to grow by only  $3.2\%$  in 2024.

Although there are opportunities for recovery, the global economic conditions in 2025 are expected to still be filled with uncertainty. As inflation subsides, several central banks around the world are likely to ease policies and provide more room for greater liquidity. However, geopolitical dynamics, increasingly evident climate change, and protectionist policies from certain countries can exacerbate instability, trigger a decline in global demand, and alter international supply chains. IMF estimates that the movement of the global economy will be around  $3.3\%$  in 2025, with the economies of developing countries, as a contributor to  $60\%$  of global economic growth, are expected to experience pressure.

Unlike the global conditions, throughout 2024, the Indonesian government successfully maintained the recovery momentum, allowing the Indonesian economy to continue growing steadily in 2024. Based on data from the Statistics Indonesia, Indonesia's trade balance recorded a surplus of USD 31.04 billion, lower than the surplus of USD 36.9 billion in 2023. Driven by the strengthening of domestic consumption, the recovery of the industrial sector, and the increase in foreign investment, Indonesia was able to maintain an economic growth rate of  $5.03\%$ , with inflation controlled at  $1.57\%$  y-o-y, and the exchange rate of the Rupiah closed at Rp16,162/USD at the end of December 2024.

The ongoing global uncertainty and fluctuations in commodity prices may affect Indonesia's economic stability in 2025. However, with prudent fiscal policies and ongoing reforms, Indonesia is expected to carve out more resilient growth amidst the challenging dynamics of the global economy. Bank Indonesia predicts that the Indonesia's economy could enter a more solid recovery phase in 2025, with a growth rate of  $4.7\% - 5.5\%$ . The technology, NRE, and manufacturing sectors are to be the main growth drivers. With

EBT, dan manufaktur diperkirakan akan menjadi pendorong utama pertumbuhan. Dengan kebujakan pemerintah yang mendukung reformasi struktural dan transformasi digital, pemerintah Indonesia memerkurakan bahwa investasi asing akan kembali mengalir.

# Mining

ICE Newcastle coal prices weakened and closed at USD 125.25/ton at the end of 2024. Energy policies that increasingly emphasize the transition to green energy, combined with the ongoing impact of the Russia-Ukraine conflict, have caused a shift in energy demand affecting the supply and prices of various global energy sources, including coal.

The mining business has a challenging business outlook in 2025, amid global economic uncertainty driven by, among others, geopolitical dynamics and the energy transition. However, the Company believes that coal will remain an important component in the energy mix in 2025. The demand for coal from Asian countries, particularly China, India, and Japan will support Indonesia's coal market.

Based on ESDM's data, Indonesia's coal production set a new record of 836 million tons in 2024, exceeding the government's target of 710 million tons. This increase in production is driven by high domestic demand to meet the needs of power generation as well as long-term export contracts with Asian countries, such as China, India, and Japan. Approximately  $70\%$  of national coal production is exported, primarily to meet demand from China and India, while the remaining  $30\%$  is allocated for domestic use. Domestically, coal is primarily utilized in the power generation sector at  $85\%$ , followed by metallurgy, fertilizer, cement, and textile industries, paper manufacturing, briquettes, and other industries.

Currently, there is no sufficiently strong positive sentiment to drive a significant increase in coal prices, so coal prices are expected to remain stable in 2025. However, the Indonesian Coal Mining Association predicts that the demand for Indonesian coal will increase along with the high demand from China, India, Japan, and domestic demand for electricity supply to support development and industrial processes. In addition, the downstream utilization of coal-based electricity is also predicted to strengthen the increase in domestic coal.

# Energi Baru & Terbarukan

Pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia tahun 2024 mendorong terjadinya pertumbuhan investasi dan konsumsi listrik nasional. Berdasarkan data ESDM, konsumsi listrik rata-rata per kapita Indonesia tercatat mencapai 1.411 kWh pada tahun 2024, mencapat  $7.78\%$  dibandingkan tahun sebelumnya dan berhasil melampaui target yang ditetapkan. Jumlah peluangan listrik juga tercatat mengalami pengkatan menjadi sebanyak 93 juta pelanggan, mencermikan perluasan akses listrik yang semakin merata. Pertumbuhan konsumsi listrik ini didukung oleh pengkatan permintaan dari sektor industri, rumah tangga, dan komersial, terutama di daerah yang mengalami pertumbuhan ekonomi pesat.

Didorong oleh peningkatan kegiatan ekonomi dan investasi di sektor manufaktur dalam negeri, PLN memerpkirakan konsumsi listrik nasional tumbuh sebesar  $6.9\%$  secara tahunan tingga 2029. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan energia yang terus mencapat, PLN mengakselerasi pembangunan pembangkit listrik dengan target kapasitas total mencapai 67 GW untukperiode dari tahun 2024 sampai dengan tahun 2033.

Sejalan dengan komitmen global untuk mencapai netralitas carbon, pembangunan pembangkit listrik difokuskan pada projek energi fosil yang lebih efisien dan projek EBT dengan upaya khusus pada peningkatan kapasitas pembangkit listrik tenaga surya, pembangkit listrik tenaga angin, dan pembangkit listrik panas bumi. Dalam konteks ini, energi surya dan energi panas bumi menjadi dualar pilar utama yang sarat menjanjikan untuk dikembangkan di Indonesia. Indonesia memiliki energi surya dengan potensi teknis luar biasa dengan intensitas radiasi matahari yang baik dan tersebut merata di seluruh wilayah. Sementara itu, Indonesia juga merupakan telah situ negara dengan cadangan panas bumi terbesar di dunia, dengan pemanfaatan energi panas bumi yang telah rendah. Berdasarkan data ESDM, hingga akhir 2024nya terdapat 2,68 GW pembangkit listrik tenaga panas bumi yang sudah terpasang. Pemerintah Indonesia juga terus mengembangkan infrastruktur jaringan listrik untuk mencakatkan keandalan pasokan listrik, termasuk melakukan pengembangan sistem smart grid dan penyimpanan energia berbasis baterai.

# New & Renewable Energy

The economic growth of Indonesia in 2024 is driving the growth of national investment and electricity consumption. Based on ESDM data, Indonesia's average per capita electricity consumption reached 1,411 kWh in 2024, an increase of  $7.78\%$  compared to the previous year, successfully surpassing the set target. The number of electricity customers also recorded an increase to 93 million customers, reflecting the more equitable expansion of electricity access. The growth in electricity consumption is supported by increased demand from the industrial, residential, and commercial sectors, especially in areas experiencing rapid economic growth.

Driven by the increase in economic activities and investments in the domestic manufacturing sector, PLN estimates that national electricity consumption will grow by  $6.9\%$  annually until 2029. To meet the continuously increasing energy demand, PLN is accelerating the construction of power plants with a total capacity target of 67 GW for the period from 2024 to 2033.

In line with the global commitment to achieving carbon neutrality, the construction of power plants is focused on more efficient fossil energy projects and NRE projects, with special efforts on increasing the capacity of solar power plants, wind power plants, and geothermal power plants. In this context, solar energy and geothermal energy become two main pillars that are very promising to be developed in Indonesia. Indonesia has solar energy with extraordinary technical potential, with good solar radiation intensity evenly distributed across the region. Meanwhile, Indonesia is also one of the countries with the largest geothermal reserves in the world, with low utilization of geothermal energy. Based on ESDM data, by the end of 2024, only 2.68 GW of geothermal power plants that have been installed. The government of Indonesia is also continuing to develop electricity grid infrastructure to enhance the reliability of electricity supply, including the development of smart grid systems and battery energy storage systems.

Seeing this strategic opportunity, the Company is actively strengthening its energy business line by focusing on the development of NRE businesses through its subsidiaries. Currently, the Company has several subsidiaries focused on the NRE business, to develop solar cell and panel projects in Jakarta and Kendal, as well as geothermal projects in Cipanas, Cisolok-Cisukarame, and Nage.

# Technology

Technological advancements continue to progress rapidly, supporting transformation in various sectors. The utilization of artificial intelligence, the internet of things, big data, cloud computing, and blockchain is becoming increasingly widespread and plays an important role in driving automation, advanced data analysis, and technology-based decision-making. The shift in society's lifestyle towards digitalization also drives the increase in internet penetration across Indonesia. Indonesia itself has significant potential for data center development, considering the rapid growth of the digital economy supported by increasing internet penetration and electronic commerce. Based on a survey by the Indonesian Internet Service Providers Association, the number of internet users in Indonesia reached 221 million people in 2024, with a penetration rate of  $79.5\%$  of the total population. This growth reflects significant potential in the digital technology sector, including the need for data center infrastructure, especially since Indonesia, supported by various strategic factors, has now developed into one of the most sought-after data center locations in Southeast Asia. With strong connectivity, high internet penetration, and an increasingly developed technology infrastructure, Indonesia's strategic geographical position makes it a very attractive location for international data center operators.

The technology business is expected to continue growing rapidly. The expected widespread adoption of 5G technology will open new opportunities in connectivity and communication, enabling the creation of a more connected and responsive ecosystem. On the other hand, with the increasing awareness of data security and privacy, the demand for more advanced cybersecurity solutions is expected to continue to rise. This digital transformation will drive the emergence of new business opportunities but will also require companies to adapt to rapid technological changes and continuously innovate to remain competitive in the global market.

# Chemicals

Chemicals play an important role in supporting the agriculture and plantation sectors, which contributes to food security for the welfare of society. The role of chemicals is becoming increasingly vital in line with the rapid growth of the world's population, amidst the extreme impacts of climate change and the limited availability of fertile land. Unfortunately, the chemical industry continues to face various significant challenges, especially the impact of the prolonged Russia-Ukraine conflict. These geopolitical tensions disrupt the supply chain of raw materials and fertilizer products, causing significant price fluctuations. The increasingly stringent regulations related to the environment and sustainability add pressure on this industry to switch to the use of environmental-friendly chemicals, which in turn leads to increased costs.

In 2024, the Company, through its subsidiaries, remains active in the chemicals business. Products are imported and distributed to meet domestic market demand, which, to this day, is still dominated by fertilizer sales to affiliated company entities. To strengthen competitiveness and ensure business sustainability, the Company has been and will continue implementing strategic measures, including expanding market share beyond affiliated company entities. In the future, the Company is committed to continuously increasing revenue and profit sustainably by diversifying chemical products and expanding the marketing network. With this strategy, the Company is confident that it can maintain its position as one of the players in the national chemicals industry. [GRI 102-14]

In addition to conducting the 4 (four) main businesses as explained above, the Company has also invested in clinic and pharmacy services through subsidiaries, i.e. GWS Medika clinics and GWS Farma pharmacies in Kalibata City, Springhill Kemayoran, Blok M, Tanjung Duren, and Sudirman Park.

Pada tahun 2024, Perseroan melalui entitas anak mencatatkan total volumeProduksi batu bara sebesar 53,1 juta ton, atas mengalami penurunan sebesar  $5.7\%$  dibandingkan total volume produksi batu bara pada tahun 2023 sebesar 56,3 juta ton. Volume produksi batu bara tahun 2024 tersebut terutama berasal dari kegiatan penambangan GEMS dan entitas anak (95,5% dari total volume produksi batu bara Perseroan)serta PT DSSE Energi Mas Utama dan entitas anak memberikan kontribusi sebesar  $4.5\%$  dari total volume produksi batu bara Perseroan.

Sejalan dengan penurunan volume Produksi, volume penjalan batu bara juga mengalami penurunan dari 56,8 juta tan pada tahun 2023 menjadi 54,3 juta tan pada tahun 2024. Dari total volume penjalan batu bara tersebut sekitar  $37\%$  tercatat dialogasikan untuk memenuhi pasar dalam negeri. Jumlah ini melebihi regulasi yang ditetapkan pemerintah sebesar  $25\%$ .

Perseroan mencatatkan pendapatan dari bisnis pertambangan sebesar USD 2.773 juta, menurun  $40.7\%$  dibandingkan pencapaian tahun 2023 sebesar USD 4.673 juta. Penurunan pendapatan ini terutama dikarenakan oleh (i) penurunan tidakibu Bara pada pasar global, (ii) pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023 sehingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam layaran posisi keuangan konsolidasian Perseroan, (iii) dampak perubahan cuaca ekstrem,serta (iv) transisi menuju energia bersih yang mempengaruh kebujanan operasional. Pendapatan yang dipereleh dari bisnis pertambangan ini memberikan kontribusi sebesar  $91.9\%$  dari total pendapatan Perseroan pada tahun 2024.

In 2024, the Company through its subsidiaries recorded a total volume of coal production of 53.1 million tons, or having a decrease of  $5.7\%$  compared to the total volume of coal production in 2023 of 56.3 million tons. The volume of coal production in 2024 was mainly contributed from the mining activities of GEMS and its subsidiaries (95.5% of the Company's total volume of coal production) and PT DSSE Energi Mas Utama and its subsidiaries contributed  $4.5\%$  of the Company's total volume of coal production.

In line with the decrease in production volume, coal sales volume also decreased from 56.8 million tons in 2023 to 54.3 million tons in 2024. Of the total volume of coal sales, approximately  $37\%$  was allocated to meet the domestic market. This amount exceeds the regulations set by the government of  $25\%$ .

The Company recorded revenue from the mining business of USD 2,773 million, a decrease of  $40.7\%$  compared to the achievement in 2023 of USD 4,673 million. The decrease was mainly due to (i) the decrease in coal prices in the global market, (ii) the transfer of all the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, resulting in GEAR no longer being consolidated into the Company's consolidated financial statements, (iii) impact of extreme weather changes, and (iv) the transition to clean energy affecting operational policies. The revenue obtained from the mining business contributed  $91.9\%$  of the Company's total income in 2024.

Tetap berpegang pada komitmen untuk menjalankan bisnis penyediaan tenaga listrik,-Sejak menjadi APA tanun terakhir, Perseroan telah menjaki tersebut peluang pengembangan pembangkit listrik berbasis EBT, dengan fokus pada pemanfaatan energi surya dan energiaapanas bumi untuk wilayah pemasaran di dalam negeri. Perseroan, melalui entitas anak, telah menuusun peta jalan pengembangan bisnis EBT, yang diharapkan dapat mendukung upaya menuju carbon netral.

Dalam hal pemanfaatan energia surya, Perseroan, melalui entitas anak, telah memiliki kontrak jangka panjang dengan PT Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology Tbk untuk memberikan layanan terintegrasi, termasuk di antaranya pengoperasian, atas PLTS atap di Marunda dan Sentul - Jawa Barat, dengan total kapasitas sebesar  $1.643\mathrm{kWp}$ . Pada bulan Desember 2024, Perseroan melalui menjadi perusahaan patungan yang dibentuk bersama dengan Trina Solar Energy Development Pte. Ltd. dan PT PLN Indonesia Power Renewables, juga telah memproduksi sel dan panel surya pertamanya di sabrik yang berlokasi di Kawasan Industri Kendal, Jawa Tengah. Pabrik sel dan panel surya terintegrasi ini memiliki kapasitas sekitar 1 GWp/tahun. Sepanjang tahun 2024, kegiatan operacional sel dan panel surya masih berada dalam的前提下 awal, seesingga kontribusinya terhadap kinerja usaha Perseroan secara keseluruhanbelum menunjukkan dampak yang signifikan. Oleh karena itu, Perseroanbelum menghitung pangsaasaridi kegiatan sel dan panel surya.

# Mlning

As part of the commitment to meet the ESDM's DMO policy of at least  $25\%$  of total coal production, the Company, through its subsidiaries, is building long-term relationships with several strategic partners, including PLN, entities within affiliated company entities, and various other customers.

In 2024, the Company's market share of coal production was  $6.4\%$ , a decrease compared to the coal market share in 2023 of  $7.3\%$ .

[GRI 102-14]

# New & Renewable Energy

With a commitment to do the power generation business, in recent years, the Company has explored various opportunities for developing NRE-based power plants, focusing on utilizing solar and geothermal energy for the domestic marketing area. The Company, through its subsidiaries, has developed a roadmap for NRE business development that is expected to support efforts towards carbon neutrality.

In terms of the utilization of solar energy, the Company, through its subsidiary, has a long-term contract with PT Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology Tbk to provide integrated services, including its operational aspect, on rooftop solar power plants in Marunda and Sentul - West Java, with a total capacity of 1,643 kWp. In December 2024, the Company, through a joint venture company established together with Trina Solar Energy Development Pte. Ltd. and PT PLN Indonesia Power Renewables, also produced its first solar cells and panels at a plant located in the Kendal Industrial Estate, Central Java. This solar cell and panel plant has a capacity of approximately 1 GWp/year. Throughout 2024, the operational activities of solar cells and panels are still in the early stage, so their contribution to the overall performance of the Company has not yet shown a significant impact. Therefore, the Company has not yet calculated the market share from solar cell and panel activities.

Dalam hal pemanfaatan energi panas bumi, Perseroan, melalui entitas anak, telah memperoleh izin dari Kementerian ESDM untuk makukanan survei pendahuluan dan/atau eksplorasi panas bumi di wilayah Cipanas dan Cisolok-Cisukarame, Jawa Barat seda wilayah Nage, Nusa Tenggara Timur. Mempertimbangkan kepada pada tahun 2024 entitas tersebut Perseroan masih berada dalam的前提下 eksplorasi, potensi sumber daya panas bumibelum dapat diketahui danbelum dapat dipasarkan. Oleh karenanya Perseroan jugabelum menghitung pengsaasar dari kegiatan pemanfaatan energi panas bumi ini.

Perseroan berupaya untuk mempercepat penyelesaian tetap eksplorasi,agar bisnis EBT dapat segera memberikan kontribusi yang lebih signifikan bagi keberlanjutan dan pertumbuhan Perseroan.

# Tecnologi

Hingga 31 Desember 2024, layanan multimedia entitas anak Perseroan, denganmerek dagang MyRepublic,lahet tersedia di 144 (seratus empat puluh empat) kota dan kabupaten di Indonesia. Dengan lebih dari 910 ribu pelanggan, pangsaasar Perseroan di bisnis multimedia di Indonesia sudah sekitar  $7 - 8\%$  pada tahun 2024. [GRI2-6-b]

Untuk pengembangan bisnis multimedia, Perseroan, melalui entitas anak, berupaya untuk memanfaatkan peluang yang ada dengan terus memperlugas jangkauan layanan tekologi di sejumlah kota potensial di Indonesia, menc Gatkan kualitas layanan berbasis digital dengan fokus pada penyediaan konektivitas internet yang stabil dan cepat, menawarkan berbagai Produk inovatif yang menarik dan sesuai dengan kebutuhan pasar denganarga yang kompetitif, serta menambah jujiah homepass pada jaringan kotakota yang sudah ada.

Dengan melihat peluangistar yang ada dalam era perkembangan dan transformasi digital, Perseroan melalui entitas anak juga akan terus mengembangkan dan memperlugasjangkauan pemasaran layanan pusat data. Layanan pusat data ini tidakanyak oleh mememperkuat infrastrukturTeknologi, tetapi juga memberikan solusi yang lebih efisien, aman, dan andal bagi pelanggan, seiring dengan mencentaknya permintaan kepada layanan digital dan komputasi awan. Sampai dengan akhir tahun 2024, layanan pusat data telah memiliki dan mengelola 25 pusat data pada 24 kota di seluruh Indonesia dengan kapasitas IT load gabungan tingga 40 MW untuk kapasitas yang telah beroperasi dan sudah dalam的前提下 pengembangan.

# Bahan Kimia

Pada tahun 2024, Perseroan mencimpor sekitar  $4,6\%$  pupuk dan  $6,3\%$  pestisida dari total impor pupuk dan pestisida Indonesia. Sebagian tersebut dari pupuk dan pestisida yang diimpor tersebut dialokasikan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan pasar domestik. In term of the utilization of geothermal energy, the Company, through its subsidiary, has obtained permission from ESDM to conduct preliminary surveys and/or geothermal exploration in Cipanas and Cisolok-Cisukarame areas of West Java, as well as the Nage area of East Nusa Tenggara. Considering that in 2024, the Company's subsidiary is still in the exploration stage, the potential of geothermal resources cannot yet be determined and cannot be marketed. # Information Technology [GRI2-6-8-d]

Teknologi Informasi (IT) memiliki peran yang penting dalam mendukung kelancaran operasional dan pertumbuhan bisnis, terutama di era digital yang semakin maju. IT bukananya sebagai pendorong efisiensi, tetapi juga sebagai elemen strategis yang berkontribusi pada pengambilan keputusan dan inovasi Produk ata layanan.

IT Perseroan berfokus pada optimalisi infrastruktur tekologi, pengembangan sistem informasi,{sertaentingkatan system keamanan data. Dengan adanyaystem yang lebih terintegrasi, Perseroan dan entitas tidak dapat mengaksi data yang lebih akurat dan kepada waktu, yang mendukungentingkatan kualitas layanan kepada pelanggan dan efisiensi operasional dengan tetap memperhatikan keamanan data perusahaan dan informasi pelanggan dari ancaman yang semakin kompleks di dunia maya.

Perseroan secara Berkala:Mengevaluasi dan mengembangkan system dan manajemen IT untuk memastikan keselarasan dengan praktik terbaik dalam tata kelola, standardisasi, integrasi, simplifikasi, keandalan, otomatisasi, keamanan, dan skalabilitas demi menujang kebutuhan bisnis, memperkuat kapabilitas internal Perseroan, dan menciptakan cara kerjabaru yang lebih efektif, efisien, dan mendorong kolaborasi. Perseroan berharap Bahwa dengan melakukan evaluasi berkala Perseroan dapat memastikan setiap perubahan tekologi yang diimplementasikan dapat memberikan dampak positif yang maksimal terhadap kinerja perusahaan.

Khusus untuk bisnis pertambangan GEMS, Perseroan, melalui entitas anak, terus berupaya makukan transformasi menuju digitalisasi pertambangan. Beberapa proyek yang telah dijalankan, antara lain sebagai berikut:

- Pelaksanaan integrasi pemantauan dan pengawasan proses tambang, akses dan analysis data untuk pengambilan keputusan, pengelolaan inventaris, dan komunikasi dan koordinasi melalui sentralisasi konektivitas cepat dan handal dari berbagai tekologi untuk menjawab tantangan industri 5.0, yaitu dengan pembangunan dan perbaikan command centre BIB

of Kalimantan, Java, and Sumatra. The Company has also successfully taken significant steps by starting efforts to expand its market reach to international markets. [GRI 2-6-b]

The Company is committed to continuously increasing revenue and profit sustainably by diversifying fertilizer and chemical products, expanding the marketing network, enhancing the manufacturing process to optimize productivity, and improving its supply chain effectiveness.

Information Technology (IT) plays an important role in supporting businesses' smooth operation and growth, especially in the increasingly advanced digital era. IT is not only a driver of efficiency but also a strategic element that contributes to decision-making and product or service innovation.

The Company's IT focuses on optimizing technology infrastructure, developing information systems, and enhancing data security systems. With a more integrated system, the Company and its subsidiaries can access more accurate and timely data, which supports the improvement of service quality to customers and operational efficiency while still paying attention to the security of company data and customer information from increasingly complex threats in the cyber world.

The Company regularly evaluates and develops IT systems and management to ensure alignment with best practices in governance, standardization, integration, simplification, reliability, automation, security, and scalability to support business needs, strengthen the Company's internal capabilities, and create new ways of working that are more effective, efficient, and promote collaboration. The Company hopes that by conducting regular evaluations, it can ensure that every implemented technological change can have a maximum positive impact on the company's performance.

Specifically for GEMS' mining business, the Company, through its subsidiaries, continues to strive for transformation towards mining digitalization. Several projects that have been undertaken, among others, are as follows:

- The implementation of the integration of monitoring and supervision of mining processes, access and data analysis for decision-making, inventory management, and communication and coordination through the centralization of fast and reliable connectivity from various technologies to address the challenges of Industry 5.0, i.e. through the construction and improvement of the BIB command center

- Pemanfaatan tekologi analitik pengawasan area tambang untuk mencegah kriminalitas, peningkatan produktivitas, dan penyelidikan insiden  
- Penggunaan otomatisasi proses robotik (host-to-host payment bank) yang mampu melakukan verifikasi secara otomatis, cepat, dan akurat untuk mencapatkan keamanan transaksi, pergerakan Barang, dan interaksi dengan pihak eksternal  
- Penerapan dasbor analitik untuk visualisasi dan analisa kinerja dan risiko interaktif pada waku nyata untuk menc Gatkan faktor keselamatan dan mengakselerasi strategi K3 pertambangan  
- Pengukuran komersial/beban kendaruan dengan berbagai dimensi panjang dalam kondisi bergerak untuk mencatkan pemantuaan tambang dan menghemat biaya operasional tambang  
- Pemanfaatan using - GEMS Smart Digital Signature untuk mempercepat, menghemat biaya, dan menjaga keamanan proses penandatangan dokumen secara digital  
- Penggunaan iServe - GA BIB Digitalization yang dapat diakses kanyakan dan tamu perusahaan melalui situs web dan aplikasi ponsel yang tersedia di Play Store ataup App Store untuk manajemen kendaranaan dan bahan bakar minyak, manajemen catering, manajemen tamu, GA Care, pemantauan day off, izin keluar masuk unit kendaranaan pribadi, dan izin keluar masuk Barang

IT Operation & Infrastructure

# Information on Corporate Actions

Investment / Acquisition

On June 21, 2024, the Company through PT DSST Mas Gemilang and PT Sinarmas Sukses Sejahtera acquired the shares of PT SF Digital Terdepan, which owns a direct subsidiary, PT SF Digital Commerce. PT SF Digital Terdepan is a holding company, which is also in the business of management consulting and retail trade via media.

On August 7, 2024, the Company through PT SMPlus Sentra Data and PT SMPlus Digital Investama acquired the shares of PT Teknovatus Solusi Sejahtera (now PT SMPlus Solusi Sejahtera), a company that conducts business activities in the technology services and other related activities.

# Expansion and/or Establishment of Subsidiary

On March 1, 2024, the Company through PT DSST Mas Gemilang and PT Sinarmas Sukses Sejahtera, established PT Sinarmas Rewired Xcellence with business activity in software development.

On July 25, 2024, the Company, through PT DSST Mas Gemilang and PT Sinarmas Sukses Sejahtera, established PT ASIX Indonesia Cerdas with business activities in the development of products and services based on digital technology.

On July 25, 2024, the Company, through PTSMPlus Digital Investama, together with LG CNS Co., Ltd. established a joint venture company, i.e. PT LG Sinarmas Technology Solutions, with business activities in the technology solutions sector and other related activities.

On October 9, 2024, the Company, through PT DSSP Power Mas Sejahtera (PMS) and PT Daya Anugerah Sejati Utama (DASU) established PT Daya Mas Cisolok Energi (DMCE) and PT Daya Mas Nage Energi (DMNE) with business activities in other management consultation and holding companies. # Regulation

Peraturan Menteri Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral No. 2 tahun 2024 tersebut Pembangkit Listrik Tenaga Surya Atap yang Terhubung pada Jaringan Tenaga Listrik Pemegang Izin Usaha Penyediaan Tenaga Listrik untuk Kepentingan Umum

# Uraian

# Description

Peraturan ditetapkan pada tanggal 29 Januari 2024, diundangkan pada tanggal 31 Januari 2024, dan berlaku sejak tanggal diundangkan. Peraturan ini mengatur, antara lain bagi ketentuan umum, sistem pembangkit listrik tenaga surya atop, dan pembinaan dan pengawasan.

Perseroan, melalui entitas anak, berupaya beradaptasi dan mencambil peluang dari peraturan ini dengan menawarkan solusiantu, speerti tekologi smart grid serta layanan EBT, serta memperkuat infrastruktur jaringan untuk mengakomodasi EBT. Perseroan dan entitas anak dapat mematuhi peraturan yang berlaku, memperbaiki citra keberlanjutan, dan mendukung dekarbonisasi.

# Financial Review

Pembahan dalam tinjauan keuangan ini dibuat berdasarkan informasi yang dipereleh dari Laporan Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan dan entitas anak ("Grup") untukperiode yang berakhir pada tanggal-tanggal 31 Desember 2024 dan 2023 yang telah diaudit oleh KAP Mirawati Sensi Idris dan diterbitkan opini wajar tanpa pengecualian.

Penyajian informasi dalam laporan keuangan tersebut telah memenuhi Standar Akuntansi Keuangan di Indonesia.

# Kebijakan Akuntansi dan Perubahannya

[GR12-2-C]

Laporan keuang konsolidasian meliputi laporan keuangan Perseroan dan entitas-entitas (termasuk entitas terstruktur) yang dikendalian oleh Grup. Pengendalian dipereleh apabila Grup memiliki seluruh hal berikut ini:

- kekuasaan atas investee  
- eksposur atau hak atas imbal telah variabel dari keterlibatannya dengan investee, dan  
- kemampuan untuk menc gunakan kekuasaannya atas investee untuk mempengaruhi jumlah imbal tersebut Grup

The discussion in this financial review is based on the information from the Consolidated Financial Statements of the Company and its subsidiaries (the "Group") for periods ended on December 31, 2024 and 2023, which were audited by KAP Mirawati Sensi Idris and issued with an unqualified opinion.

The presentation of information in the financial statements has been in compliance with Financial Accounting Standards in Indonesia.

# Accounting Policy and Its Changes

[GRI2-2-C]

The consolidated financial statements incorporate the financial statements of the Company and entities (including structured entities) controlled by the Group. Control is achieved when the Group has all the followings:

power over the investee  
exposure or rights, to variable returns from its involvement with the investee, and  
- ability to use its power to affect its returns

Pengkonsolidasian entitiesanagan dimulai pada saat Grup memperoleh pengendalian atas entitiesanagan berakhir pada saat Grup kehilangan pengendalian atas entitiesanagan. Secara khusus, penghasilan dan telah entitiesanagan yang diakuisisi oleh dilepaskan selamaperiode berjalan termasuk dalam layoran LABa rugi dan penghasilan komprehensif lain konsolidasian sejak tanggal Grup memperoleh pengendalian sampai dengan tanggal Grup kehilangan pengendalian atas entitiesanagan.

Seluruh aset dan liabilitas, ekuitas, penghasilan,(Beban dan arus kas dalam intra kelompok usaha terkait dengan transaksi antar entitas dalam Grup dieliminasi secara摄入 dalam laporan keuangan konsolidasian.

Laba rugi dan setiap komponen penghasilan komprehensif lain diatribusikan kepada pemilik Perseroan dan Kepentingan Non-Pengendali (KNP) meskipun hal tersebut membuat katikan KNP memiliki saldo defisit.

KNP disajikan dalam laporan labarugi dan penghasilan komprehensif lain konsolidasian dan dalam ekuitas pada laporan posisi keuangan konsolidasian, terpisah dari bagian yang dapat diatribusikan kepada pemilik Perseroan.

Transaksi dengan KNP yang tidak inginibatkan hilangnya pengendalian DICAT sebagai transaksi ekuitas. Selisih antara nilai wajar imbalan yang dialihkan dengan bagian relatif atas nilai tercatat aset bersih entitas anak yang diakuisisi dicatat di ekuitas. Keuntungan kepada kerugian dari pelepasan kepada KNP juga dicatat di ekuitas.

Kombiniasi bisnis, kecuali kombiniasi bisnis entitas sepengendali, dicatat dengan mencgunakan metode akuisisi. Biaya perolehan dari sebelum akuisisi diukur pada nilai agregat imbalan yang dialihkan, diukur pada nilai wajar pada tanggal akuisisi dan jumlah setupk NNP pada pihak yang diakuisisi. Untuk setup kombiniasi bisnis, pihak pengakuisisi mengukur KNP pada entitas yang diakuisisi pada nilai wajar atau sebesar proporsi kepemilikan KNP atas aset neto yang teridentifikasi dari entitas yang diakuisisi. Biaya-biaya akuisisi yang timbul dibebankan langsung dan disajikan sebagai "Beban Lain-Lain".

Ketika melakukan akuisisi atas menjadi bisnis, Grup mengklasifikasikan dan menentukan aset keuang yang dipereleh dan reliitasakan keuangan yang diambil alih berdasarkan pada persyaratan kontraktual, kondisi ekonomi dan kondisi terkait lain yang ada pada tanggal akuisisi. Grup dapat memilih untuk mencapkan 'pengujian konsentrasi nilai wajar' yang mengizinkan penilaian yang disederhanakan kepada rangkaian aktivitas dan aset yang diakuisisi bukan merupakan suatu bisnis. Pengujian konsentrasi dapat diterapkan secara terpisah untuk setiap transaksi. Pengujian konsentrasi opsional terpenuhi jika secara substansial seluruh nilai wajar aset bruto yang diakuisisi terkonsentrasi dalam aset teridentifikasi tunggal atau kelompok aset teridentifikasi serupa. Consolidation of a subsidiary begins when the Group obtains control over the subsidiary and ceases when the Group loses control of the subsidiary. Specifically, income and expenses of a subsidiary acquired or disposed of during the period are included in the consolidated statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income from the date the Group gains control until the date when the Group ceases to control the subsidiary.

All intragroup assets and liabilities, equity, income, expenses and cash flows relating to transactions between members of the Group are eliminated in full on consolidated financial statements.

Profit or loss and each component of other comprehensive income are attributed to the owners of the Company and to the Non-Controlling Interest (NCI) although such thing causes NCI having a deficit balance.

NCI is presented in the consolidated statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income and under the equity section of the consolidated statement of financial position respectively, separately from the corresponding portion attributable to owners of the Company.

Transactions with NCI that do not result in loss of control are accounted for as equity transactions. The difference between the fair value of any consideration paid and the relevant share acquired of the carrying value of net assets of the subsidiary is recorded in equity. Gains or losses on disposals to NCI are also recorded in equity.

Business combinations, except business combinations among entities under common control, are accounted for using the acquisition method. The cost of an acquisition is measured as the aggregate of the consideration transferred, measured at the acquisition date the fair value and the amount of any NCI in the acquiree. For each business combination, the acquirer measures the NCI in the acquiree either at fair value or at the proportionate share of the acquiree's identifiable net assets. Acquisition related costs incurred are directly expensed and included in "Other Expenses".

When the Group acquires a business, it assesses the financial assets acquired and liabilities assumed for appropriate classification and designation in accordance with the contractual terms, economic circumstances and pertinent conditions as of the acquisition date. The Group has an option to apply a 'fair value concentration test' that permits a simplified assessment of whether an acquired set of activities and assets is not a business. The concentration test can be applied on a transaction-by-transaction basis. The optional concentration test is met if substantially all of the fair value of the gross assets acquired is concentrated in a single identifiable asset or Group of similar identifiable assets. If the test is met, the set of activities and assets is determined not to be a business and no further assessment is needed. If the test is not met, or if the

aktivitas dan aset ditentukan bukan merupakan suatu bisnis dan tidak diperlukan penilaian lanjutan. Jika pengujian tidak terpenuhi oleh jika Grup memilih untuk tidak mencapkan pengujian tersebut, penilaian yang detail harus dilakukan sesuai dengan persyaratan normal dalam PSAK No. 103 mengenai "Kombiniasi Bisnis".

Dalam suatu kombiniasi bisnis yang dilakukan secara bertahap, pada tanggal akuisisi pihak pengakuisisi tersebut kembali nilai wajar kepentingan ekuitas yang dimiliki sebelumnya pada pihak yang diakuisisi dan membuat keuntungan ata kerugian yang dihasilan dalam laba rugi.

Pada tanggal akuisisi, goodwill awalnya diukur pada hora perolehan yang merupakan selisih lebih nilai.agregat dari imbalan yang dialihkan dan jumlah yang diakui untuk KNP atas aset bersih teridentifikasi yang dipereleh dan reliabilitas yang diambil alih. Jika nilai.agregat tersebut but lebih kecil dari nilai wajar aset neto entitas anak yang diakuisisi, selisih tersebut diakui dalam laba rugi.

Setelah pengakuan awal, goodwill diukur pada jumlah tercatat dikurangi akumulasi kerugian penurunan nilai. Untuk tujuan uji penurunan nilai, goodwill yang dipereleh dari suatu kombiniasi bisnis, sejak tanggal akuisisi, dialogasikan kepada setup Unit Penghasil Kas ("UPK") dari Perseroan dan/atau entitas anak yang diharapkan akan menerima manfaat dari sinergi kombiniasi tersebut, terlepas dari apakah aset atau reliabilitas lain dari pihak yang diakuisisi dialogasikan ke UPK tersebut.

Jika goodwill telah dialokasikan pada suatu UPK dan operasi tertentu atas UPK tersebut dihentikan, makai goodwill yang diasosiasikan dengan operasi yang dihentikan tersebut termasuk dalam jumlah tercatat operasi tersebut ketika menentukan keuntungan kepada kerugian dari pelepasan. Goodwill yang dilepaskan tersebut diukur berdasarkanNILAI relatif operasi yang dihentikan dan porsi UPK yang ditahan.

Imbalan kontinjensi yang dialihkan oleh pihak pengakuisisi diakui sebesar nilai wajar pada tanggal akuisisi. Perubahan nilai wajar atas imbalan kontinjensi setelah tanggal akuisisi yang diklasifikasikan sebagai aset ata liabilitas, akan diakui dalam labu rugi kepada penghasilan komprehensif lain sesuai dengan PSAK No. 109. Jika diklasifikasikan sebagai ekuitas, imbalan kontinjensi tidak diukur kembali dan penyelesaian selanjutnya diperhitungkan dalam ekuitas.

Jika proses akuntansi awal untuk kombiniasi bisnisbelum selesai pada akhirperiode pelaporan saat kombiniasi terjadi, maka Grup melaporkan jumlah sementara untuk pos-pos yang proses akuntansinya belum selesai. Jumlah-jumlah sementara tersebut disesuaikan Selamaperiode pengukuran,atau aset atopu liabilitas tambahan diakui,untuk mencerminkan informasi Barang yang dipereleh bagiakta dan keadaan yang ada pada tanggal akuisisi dan jika diketahui, tetaherdampak pada pengukuran jumlahjumlah yang diakui pada tanggal tersebut.

Group elects not to apply the test, a detailed assessment must be performed by applying the normal requirements in PSAK No. 103 regarding "Business Combination".

In the business combination that is achieved in stages, on the acquisition date the fair value of the acquirer's previously held equity interest in the acquiree is remeasured to the fair value at the acquisition date through profit or loss.

At the acquisition date, goodwill is initially measured at cost being the excess of the aggregate of the consideration transferred and the amount recognized for NCI over the net identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed. If this consideration is lower than the fair value of the net assets of the subsidiary acquired, the difference is recognized in profit or loss.

After initial recognition, goodwill is measured at cost less any accumulated impairment losses. For the purpose of impairment testing, goodwill acquired in a business combination is, from the acquisition date, allocated to each of the Company and/or its subsidiaries' Cash-Generating Units ("CGU") that are expected to benefit from the combination, irrespective of whether other assets or liabilities of the acquiree are assigned to those CGUs.

Where goodwill forms part of a CGU and part of the operation within that CGU is disposed of, the goodwill associated with the operation disposed of is included in the carrying amount of the operation when determining the gain or loss on disposal of the operation. Goodwill disposed of in this circumstance is measured based on the relative values of the operation disposed of and the portion of the CGU retained.

Any contingent consideration to be transferred by the acquirer will be recognized at fair value at the acquisition date. Subsequent changes to the fair value of the contingent consideration which is deemed to be an asset or liability will be recognized in accordance with PSAK No. 109, either in profit or loss, or as other comprehensive income. If the contingent consideration is classified as equity, it should not be measured until it is finally settled within equity.

If the initial accounting for a business combination is incomplete by the end of the reporting period in which the combination occurs, the Group reports provisional amounts for the items for which the accounting is incomplete. Those provisional amounts are adjusted during the measurement period, or additional assets or liabilities are recognized, to reflect new information obtained about facts and circumstances that existed at the acquisition date that, if known, would have affected the amounts recognized at that date.

3. Amendemen PSAK No. 116, "Sewa" erkait Liabilitas Sewa pada transaksi Jual dan Sewa Balik.

Aset

The application of the following revised financial accounting standards, which are effective from January 1, 2024 and relevant for the Group, did not result in substantial changes to the Group's accounting policies and had no material impact on the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements:

1. Amendment to PSAK No. 201, "Presentation of financial statements" about Liabilities Classification as Current or Non-Current.  
2. Amendment to PSAK No. 201, "Presentation of Financial Statements" about Non-Current Liabilities with Covenants.  
3. Amendment to PSAK No. 116, "Lease" about Lease Liability in a Sale and Leaseback.  
4. Amendments to PSAK 207 "Statement of Cash Flows" and amendments PSAK 107 "Financial Instruments: Disclosures" about supplier finance arrangements.

The information regarding accounting policy and its changes can be seen in the Consolidated Financial Statement in Section No. 2 regarding "Material Accounting Policy Information" and No. 47 regarding "Changes to Statements of Financial Accounting Standards".

Piutang usaha pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 mengalami penurunan sebesar USD 94,6 juta dibandingkan tahun sebelumnya, terutama disebabkan karena penurunan piutang usaha milik grup GEMS sebesar USD 89,2 juta terutama dari penurunan piutang usaha - pihak ketiga sebesar USD 82,0 juta dan penurunan piutang usaha - pihak berelasi sebesar USD 7,2 juta.

Piutang usaha pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 mengalami penurunan sebesar USD 188,7 juta dibandingkan tahun sebelumnya, terutama disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, sehingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan-Sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

Berdasarkan evaluasi manajemen terhadap kolektibilitas saldo masing-masing piutang usaha pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 dan 2023, manajemen berpendapat oleh kadangan kerugian penurunan nilai memadai untuk menutup pemungkanan kerugian dari tidak tertagihnya piutang.

# Piutang Lain-Lain

Kenaikan tersebut dikurangi terutama oleh penurunan dari piutang lain - lain pihak ketiga dari PT Elang Andalan Nusantara sebesar USD 29,6 juta.

Piutang lain-lain pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 mengalami kenaikan sebesar USD 15,8 juta dibandingkan tahun sebelumnya, terutama disebabkan karena kenaikan pada piutang lain - lain pihak ketiga dari PT Pintar Nusantara Sejahtera sebesar USD 23,9 juta dan PT Elang Andalan Nusantara sebesar USD 19,5 juta. Kenaikan tersebut dikurangi terutama oleh penurunan pada piutang lain - lain pihak ketiga dari PT Satelit Nusantara Lima sebesar USD 19,8 juta dan penurunan karena pelunasan pada piutang Datang Overseas (Hong Kong) Energy Investment Co., Limited sebesar USD 7,0 juta.

# Persediaan

# Aset Tetap

Aset tetap pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 651,1 juta, atas naik sebesar USD 101,2 juta dibandingkan dengan USD 549,9 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Kenaikan tersebut terutama disebabkan karena penambahan aset dalam konstruksi dan peralatan telekomunikasi untuk proyek homepass dikurangi dengan penjualan aset tetap terutama dari pembangkit listrik yang dimiliki Perseroan.

Aset tetap pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 549,9 juta, oleh turun sebesar USD 991,8 juta dibandingkan dengan USD 1.541,7 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, sehingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan-Sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

# Aset Pertambangan

Aset pertambangan pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 326,4 juta, atas naik sebesar USD 50,5 juta dibandingkan dengan USD 275,9 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Kenaikan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh adanya penambahan aset pertambangan dari penambahan tambang dalam pengembangan, dan aset aktivitas pengupasan lapisan tanah selama tahun berjalan dengan rumah sebesar USD 87,8 juta, dikurangi dengan amortisasi sebesar USD 27,7 juta, penurunan nilai sebesar USD 7,8 juta dan selisih kurs penjabaran laporan keuangan sebesar USD 1,8 juta.

Aset pertambangan pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 275,9 juta, oleh turun sebesar USD 1.300,7 juta dibandingkan dengan USD 1.576,6 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, sehingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan-Sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

# Property, Plant, and Equipment

Property, plant, and equipment as of December 31, 2024, were USD 651.1 million, or increased by USD 101.2 million compared to USD 549.9 million at the end of 2023. Property, plant, and equipment as of December 31, 2023, were USD 549.9 million, or decreased by USD 991.8 million compared to USD 1,541.7 million at the end of 2022. # Mine Properties

Mine properties as of December 31, 2024, were USD 326.4 million, or increased by USD 50.5 million compared to USD 275.9 million at the end of 2023. Mine properties as of December 31, 2023, were USD 275.9 million, or decreased by USD 1,300.7 million compared to USD 1,576.6 million at the end of 2022. Pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024, Grup memiliki liabilitas jangka pendek sebesar USD 857,4 juta, naik sebesar  $3.8\%$  dari liabilitas jangka pendek pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 sebesar USD 825,7 juta. Kenaikan liabilitas jangka pendek ini terutama disebabkan karena kenaikan utang lain - lain sebesar USD 86,7 juta, liabilitas jangka panjang yang akan jatuh tempo dalam waktu tahun sebesar USD 34,5 juta, beban akrual sebesar USD 8,3 juta, dan uang muka pelanggan sebesar USD 6,3 juta, dikurangi dengan penurunan utang usaha sebesar USD 94,0 juta dan utang bank jangka pendek sebesar USD 8,1 juta.

As of December 31, 2024, the Group had current liabilities of USD 857.4 million, increasing by  $3.8\%$  from the current liabilities as of December 31, 2023, which amounted to USD 825.7 million. The increase in current liabilities was mainly due to the increase of the other current payable by USD 86.7 million, current portion of long-term liabilities by USD 34.5 million, accrued expenses by USD 8.3 million, and advances from customers by USD 6.3 million net-off by the decrease of trade account payable by USD 94.0 million and short-term bank loans by USD 8.1 million.

Pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023, Grup memiliki liabilitas jangka pendek sebesar USD 825,7 juta, turun sebesar  $50.5\%$  dari liabilitas jangka pendek pada tanggal 31 Desember 2022 sebesar USD 1.667,4 juta. Penurunan liabilitas jangka pendek ini terutama disebabkan karena penurunan liabilitas jangka panjang yang akan jatuh tempo dalam waktu tahun sebesar USD 352,4 juta, beban akrual sebesar USD 339,3 juta, utang pajak sebesar USD 247,4 juta, uang muka pelanungan sebesar USD 82,6 juta, utang lain - lain sebesar USD 12,7 juta dan utang usaha sebesar USD 12,4 juta, dikurangi dengan kenaikan utang bank jangka pendek sebesar USD 203,5 juta.

# Utang Bank Jangka Pendek

Utang bank jangka pendek pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 249,9 juta, oleh turun sebesar USD 8,1 juta dibanding USD 258,0 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan utang bank ke PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk dan PT Bank Danamon Indonesia Tbk masing-masing sebesar USD 44,5 juta dan USD 3,3 juta, dikurangi dengan kenaikan utang bank ke PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk dan PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk masing-masing sebesar USD 19,7 juta dan USD 18,4 juta.

Utang bank jangka pendek pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 258,0 juta, oleh naik sebesar USD 203,5 juta dibanding USD 54,5 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Kenaikan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh kenaikan utang bank ke PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk, dan PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk masing-masing sebesar USD 120,4 juta, USD 58,2 juta dan USD 38,8 juta, dikurangi dengan penurunan utang bank ke PT Bank Central Asia Tbk dan Clearmatch Originate Pty. Ltd. masing-masing sebesar USD 9,9 juta dan USD 4,0 juta.

# Utang Usaha

Utang usaha pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 270,4 juta, atas turun sebesar USD 94,0 juta dibanding USD 364,4 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh penurutan utang usaha dari bisnis pertambangan.

Utang usaha pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 364,4 juta, atas turun sebesar USD 12,4 juta dibanding USD 376,8 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan utang usaha dari bisnis pertambangan.

# Utang Lain-Lain

Utang lain-lain pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 148,5 juta, ata naik sebesar USD 86,7 juta dibanding USD 61,8 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Kenaikan tersebut terutama disebabkan karena kenaikan utang lain - lain kepada kontraktor sebesar USD 85,9 juta yang merupakan kontraktor untuk projek homepass MyRepublic.

As of December 31, 2023, the Group had current liabilities of USD 825.7 million, decreased by  $50.5\%$  from the current liabilities as of December 31, 2022, which amounted to USD 1,667.4 million. The decrease in current liabilities was mainly due to the decrease of the current portion of long-term liabilities by USD 352.4 million, accrued expenses by USD 339.3 million, taxes payable by USD 247.4 million, advances from customers by USD 82.6 million, other accounts payable by USD 12.7 million, trade accounts payable by USD 12.4 million, and, net-off by the increase of short-term bank loans by USD 203.5 million.

# Short-Term Bank Loans

Short-term bank loans as of December 31, 2024, were USD 249.9 million, or decreased by USD 8.1 million compared to USD 258.0 million at the end of 2023. The decrease was mainly due to the decrease of bank loan to PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk and PT Bank Danamon Indonesia Tbk by USD 44.5 million and USD 3.3 million respectively, net-off with the increase of bank loan to PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk and PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk. by USD 19.7 million and USD 18.4 million, respectively.

Short-term bank loans as of December 31, 2023, were USD 258.0 million, or increased by USD 203.5 million compared to USD 54.5 million at the end of 2022. The increase was mainly due to the increase of bank loan to PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk, and PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk by USD 120.4 million, USD 58.2 million, and USD 38.8 million respectively, net-off with the decrease of bank loan to PT Bank Central Asia Tbk and Clearmatch Originate Pty. Ltd. by USD 9.9 million and USD 4.0 million, respectively.

# Trade Accounts Payable

Trade accounts payable as of December 31, 2024, were USD 270.4 million, or decreased by USD 94.0 million compared to USD 364.4 million at the end of 2023. The decrease was primarily due to the decrease in trade accounts payable from mining business.

Trade accounts payable as of December 31, 2023, were USD 364.4 million, or decreased by USD 12.4 million compared to USD 376.8 million at the end of 2022. The decrease was primarily due to the decrease in trade accounts payable by mining business.

# Other Accounts Payable

Other accounts payable as of December 31, 2024, were USD 148.5 million, or increased by USD 86.7 million compared to USD 61.8 million at the end of 2023. The increase was mainly due to an increase in other payables to contractors, amounting to USD 85.9 million, which is related to contractors for the MyRepublic homepass project.

Utang lain-lain pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 61,8 juta, atas turun sebesar USD 12,7 juta dibanding USD 74,5 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, sehingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan-Sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

# Beban Akrual

Beban akrual pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 51,0 juta, atas naik sebesar USD 8,3 juta dibanding USD 42,7 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Kenaikan tersebut terutama disebabkan kenaikan akrual biaya bunga sebesar USD 3,5 juta, kenaikan akrual biaya gaji sebesar USD 2,5 juta, dan kenaikan akrual biaya royalti sebesar USD 0,4 juta.

Baban akrual pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 42,7 juta, oleh turun sebesar USD 339,3 juta dibanding USD 382,0 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, sehingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

# Utang Pajak

Utang pajak pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 adalah sebesar USD 7,8 juta, atas turun sebesar USD 4,2 juta dibanding USD 12,0 juta pada akhir tahun 2023. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan utang pajak dari bisnis pertambangan.

Utang pajak pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 adalah sebesar USD 12,0 juta, atas turun sebesar USD 247,4 juta dibanding USD 259,4 juta pada akhir tahun 2022. Penurunan tersebut terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan utang pajak dari bisnis pertambangan.

# Liabilities Jangka Panjang

Other accounts payable as of December 31, 2023, were USD 61.8 million, or decreased by USD 12.7 million compared to USD 74.5 million at the end of 2022. The decrease was mainly due to the transfer of all the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023.

# Accrued Expenses

Accrued expenses as of December 31, 2024, were USD 51.0 million, or increased by USD 8.3 million compared to USD 42.7 million at the end of 2023. The increase was mainly due to the increase of accrued interest by USD 3.5 million, increase of accrued salaries by USD 2.5 million, and increase of accrued royalty by USD 0.4 million.

Accrued expenses as of December 31, 2023, were USD 42.7 million, or decreased by USD 339.3 million compared to USD 382.0 million at the end of 2022. The decrease was mainly due to the transfer of all of the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023.

# Taxes Payable

Taxes payable as of December 31, 2024, were USD 7.8 million, or decreased by USD 4.2 million compared to USD 12.0 million at the end of 2023. The decrease was mainly due to the decrease in taxes payable from mining business.

Taxes payable as of December 31, 2023, were USD 12.0 million, or decreased by USD 247.4 million compared to USD 259.4 million at the end of 2022. The decrease was mainly due to the decrease in taxes payable from the mining business.

Pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023, Grup memiliki liabilitas jangka panjang sebesar USD 516,8 juta. Grup mengalami penurunan terutama pada liabilitas jangka panjang - setelah dikurangi bagian yang akan jatuh tempo dalam waktu tahun seharam USD 681,4 juta, liabilitas pajak tangguhan sebesar USD 226,3 juta, liabilitas jangka panjang lainnya sebesar USD 200,6 juta, dan utang lain-lain sebesar USD 148,0 juta.

# Utang Lain-Lain

Utang lain-lain pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 tidak mengalami perubahan yang signifikan dibandingkan tahun sebelumnya,anyak sedikit menurun sebesar USD 0,1juta.

Penurunan utang lain-lain menjadi USD 0,1 juta pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 terutama berasal dari penurunan imbalan kontinjensi - royalti pemasok dan terutama disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, Seeingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikanerti ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

# Liabilitas Pajak Tangguhan

Penurunan liabilitas pajak tangguhan menjadi USD 15,8 juta pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan liabilitas pajak tangguhan dari bisnis pertambangan.

As of December 31, 2024, the Group's non-current liabilities amounted to USD 894.1 million. The Group increased mainly of long-term liabilities - netted off current portion by USD 383.1 million and other non-current liabilities by USD 3.4 million, netted off with deferred tax liabilities by USD 7.3 million.

As of December 31, 2023, the Group's non-current liabilities amounted to USD 516.8 million. The Group decreased mainly of long-term liabilities - netted off current portion by USD 681.4 million, deferred tax liabilities by USD 226.3 million, other non-current liabilities by USD 200.6 million, and other accounts payable by USD 148.0 million.

# Other Accounts Payable

Other accounts payable as of December 31, 2024, did not change significantly compared to that of the previous year, only slightly decreased by USD 0.1 million.

The decrease of other accounts payable to USD 0.1 million as of December 31, 2023, was mainly from the decrease from contingent consideration - vendor royalties and due to the transfer of all of the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023.

# Deferred Tax Liabilities

The decrease of deferred tax liabilities to USD 15.8 million as of December 31, 2024, was mainly from the decrease in deferred tax liabilities from the mining.

Penurunan liabilitas pajak tangguhan menjadi USD 23,1 juta pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 terutama berasal dari bisnis pertambangan yang disebabkan karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, Seeinga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

# Utang Bank dan Lembaga Keuangan Jangka Panjang (termasuk Bagian yang akan Jatuh Tempo dalam Waktu Satu Tahun)

Kenaikan utang bank dan lembaga keuang jangka panjang (termasuk bagian yang akan jatuh tempo dalam waktu tahun)unjadi USD 860,5 juta pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 terutama disebabkan oleh kenaikan utang bank PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk sebesar USD 270,8 juta,;peneritan utang obligasi sebesar USD 227,0 juta,dan peneritan sukuk mudharakah sebesar USD 81,2 juta, dikurangi dengan penurunan utang bank PT Bank Central Asia Tbk sebesar USD 60,9 juta, utang PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur(Persero) sebesar USD 54,3 juta, utang PT Indonesia Infrastructure Finance sebesar USD 35,1 juta, dan utang bank PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk sebesar USD 33,0 juta.

Penurunan utang bank dan lembaga keuangan jangka panjang (termasuk bagian yang akan jatuh tempo dalam waktu tahun)unjedi USD 477,4 juta pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan Senior Secured Notes sebesar USD 338,2 juta, Global Loan Agency Services Australia Pty. Ltd. sebesar USD 329,3 juta, liabilitas sewa pembiayaan sebesar USD 199,4 juta, dikurangi dengan kenaikan utang bank PT Bank Central Asia Tbk sebesar USD 147,5 juta dan PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk sebesar USD 31,5 juta.

# Ekuitas

The decrease of deferred tax liabilities to USD 23.1 million as of December 31, 2023, was mainly from mining business due to the transfer of all the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023.

# Long-term Loan to Banks and Financial Institutions (including Current Portion)

The increase in long-term bank and financial institution debt (including the portion due within one year) to USD 860.5 million as of December 31, 2024, was mainly due to an increase in bank loan from PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk amounted to USD 270.8 million, the issuance of bonds amounted to USD 227.0 million, and the issuance of sukuk mudharabah amounted to USD 81.2 million, net-off with the decrease in bank loan from PT Bank Central Asia Tbk of USD 60.9 million, loan from PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur (Persero) of USD 54.3 million, loan from PT Indonesia Infrastructure Finance of USD 35.1 million, and bank loan from PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk of USD 33.0 million.

The decrease of long-term loan to banks and financial institutions (including the current portion) to USD 477.4 million as of December 31, 2023, was mainly due to the decrease of Senior Secured Notes by USD 338.2 million, Global Loan Agency Services Australia Pty. Ltd. by USD 329.3 million, lease liabilities by USD 199.4 million, and net-off with the increase of bank loan to PT Bank Central Asia Tbk by USD 147.5 million and PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk by USD 31.5 million.

Ekuitas 2023 / Equity in 2023

![](https://cdn-mineru.openxlab.org.cn/result/2025-10-20/c539f125-c234-4332-a3e5-5557d106b0ca/811be1b7f140e248b976c7afd375d61e68af7e780fbdfa8f49fc99fbbcf36dcb.jpg)  
Ekuitas 2024 / Equity in 2024

Ekuitas Grup pada tanggal 31 Desember 2024 mengalami kenaikan sebesar  $12.9\%$  dari USD 1.720,8 juta pada tahun 2023 menjadi USD 1.943,6 juta, terutama disebabkan oleh dengan kenaikan saldo laba ditahan tahun berjalan sebesar USD 354,1 juta, tambahan modal disetor - bersih sebesar USD 41,6 juta, Keuntungan yangbelum direalisasi atas kenaikan nilai wajar investasi yang diukur pada nilai wajar melalui penghasilan komprehensif lain sebesar USD 19,0 juta dan penjualan saham treasuri sebesar USD 7,4 juta dikurangi dengan penurunan atas selisih revaluasi aset tetap karena penjuanan power plant perseroan sebesar USD 160.2 juta.

Ekuitas Grup pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023 mengalami penurunan sebesar  $43,7\%$  dari USD 3.058,0 juta pada tahun 2022 menjadi USD 1.720,8 juta, terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan kepentangan nonpengendali sebesar USD 647,9 juta, tambahan modal disetor - bersih sebesar USD 617,9 karena telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, seesingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan sejak bulan Agustus 2023. Selain itu juga terdapat transaksi pembelian saham treasury pada tahun 2023 sebesar USD 483,8 juta dikurangi dengan kenaikan saldo laba ditahun tahun berjalan sebesar USD 414,7 juta.

The Group's equity as of December 31, 2024 increased by  $12.9\%$  from USD 1,720.8 million in 2023 to USD 1,943.6 million, mainly due to the increase in retained earnings for the year amounted to USD 354.1 million, additional paid-in capital - net amounted to USD 41.6 million, unrealized gains from the increase in fair value of investments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income amounted to USD 19.0 million, and the sale of treasury shares amounting to USD 7.4 million, net-off with the decrease in the revaluation surplus of fixed assets due to the sale of the Company's power plant amounted to USD 160.2 million.

The Group's equity as of December 31, 2023 decreased by  $43.7\%$  from USD 3,058.0 million in 2022 to USD 1,720.8 million, mainly due to the decrease of non-controlling interests by USD 647.9 million, Additional paid-in capital - net by USD 617.9 million, due to the transfer of all of the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023. Besides, there were also treasury share purchase transactions in 2023 that amounted to USD 483.8 million, netted off with the increase in retained earnings for the current year amounted to USD 414.7 million.

Pendapatan usaha Grup disumbangkan oleh bisnis yang dijalankan oleh Perseroan dan entitas anak Perseroan yaitu pertambangan, tekologi (penyediaan TV berbayar & internet), EBT, dan bahan kimia di mana bisnis pertambangan menyumbangkan sebesar  $91.9\%$  dan  $93.2\%$  dari keseluruhan pendapatan usaha Grup pada tahun 2024 dan 2023.

Pada tahun 2024, pendapatan usaha Grup mencapai USD 3.017,8 juta, ata turun  $39.8\%$  jika dibandingkan dengan pendapatan usaha pada tahun 2023, yaitu sebesar USD 5.014,7 juta, terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan pendapatan usaha dari pertambangan sebesar USD 1.900,2 juta terutama disebabkan penurunan tidak acuan batubara dan telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, seesingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan-Sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

Pada tahun 2023, pendapatan usaha Grup mencapai USD 5.014,7 juta, ata turun  $15.8\%$  jika dibandingkan dengan pendapatan usaha pada tahun 2022, yaitu sebesar USD 5.956,1 juta, terutama disebabkan oleh penurunan pendapatan usaha dari pertambangan sebesar USD 1.010,6 juta terutama disebabkan penurunan tidak acuan batu bara dan telah dilakukanya pengalihan seluruh saham Perseroan dalam GEAR pada bulan Agustus 2023, Seeingga GEAR tidak dikonsolidasikan lagi ke dalam Laporan Posisi Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan-Sejak bulan Agustus 2023.

The Group's revenues were contributed by businesses operated by the Company and its subsidiaries, i.e., mining, technology (pay-TV & internet services), NRE, and chemicals, in which mining business had contributed  $91.9\%$  and  $93.2\%$  of the Group's revenues in 2024 and 2023, respectively.

In 2024, the Group's revenues was USD 3,017.8 million, or decreased by  $39.8\%$  compared to the revenues in 2023 of USD 5,014.7, which was mainly due to the decrease of revenue from mining business by USD 1,900.2 million due to reduction of Indonesia's benchmark thermal coal price and due to the transfer of all of the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023.

In 2023, the Group's revenues was USD 5,014.7 million, or decreased by  $15.8\%$  compared to the revenues in 2022 of USD 5,956.1 million, which was mainly due to the decrease of revenue from mining business by USD 1,010.6 million due to reduction of Indonesia's benchmark thermal coal price and due to the transfer of all of the Company's shares in GEAR in August 2023, so that GEAR was no longer consolidated into the Company's Consolidated Statements of Financial Position since August 2023.

# Beban Usaha

In 2024, the Group's cost of revenues amounted to USD 1,789.4 million or decreased by  $39.2\%$  compared to the cost of revenues in 2023 of USD 2,942.4 million. In 2023, the Group's cost of revenues amounted to USD 2,942.4 million or decreased by  $11.3\%$  compared to the cost of revenues in 2022 of USD 3,318.1 million.
