In addition to ensuring that the structure of the Risk Management Committee members remains aligned with the company's needs, this review process is also intended to evaluate the suitability of the qualifications, experience, and diversity of perspectives of the Risk Management Committee members, as well as to ensure that the Risk Management Committee can perform its functions objectively and effectively.

# Kriteria Pengangkatan

# Komite Manajemen Risiko

# Appointment Criteria for

# the Risk Management Committee

Persyaratan umum keanggotaan Komite Manajemen Risiko Perseroan, antara lain sebagai berikut:

- khusus untuk anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko yang juga menjabat sebagai Komisari Independen, telah memenuhi persyaratan sebagaimana diatur dalam Peraturan 0JK No. 33/POJK.04/2014 tersebut Direksi dan Dewan Komisari Emiten atta Perusahaan Publik  
- bukan merupakan orang yang bekerja ata mempunyai wewenang dan tanggung jawab untuk merencanakan, memimpin, dan mengendalan kegiatan Perseroan  
- tidyak mempunyai saham baik secara langsung maupun tidyak langsung pada Perseroan  
- tidyk mempunyai hubungan affiliasi dengan Perseroan, anggota Dewan Komisaris, anggota Direksi, ata Pemegang Saham Utama Perseroan  
- tidyak mempunyai hubungan usaha baik langsung maupun tidyak langsung yang Berkaitan dengan kegiatan usaha Perseroan  
- memiliki integritas tinggi, kemampuan, pengetahunan, dan pengalamanyang sesuai dengan bidang pekerjaannya  
- memiliki kemampuan komunikasi, kerja sama,<serta komitmen untuk melaksanan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya  
- mematuhi Kode Etik Perseroan

Perseroan tidak memiliki anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko yang sebelumnya untuk karyawan kepada mitra dari auditor eksternal Perseroan dalam 2 (dua) tahun terakhir. ACGS(P)E.3.1.

General requirements for each of the members of the Risk Management Committee, among others, are as follows:

- specifically for members of the Risk Management Committee who also serve as Independent Commissioners, having fulfilled the requirements as stipulated in OJK Regulation No. 33/POJK.04/2014 on the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners of Issuers or Public Companies  
not a person who is working for or having the authority and responsibility for planning, directing, and controlling the activities of the Company  
not owning shares either directly or indirectly in the Company  
not having any affiliation with the Company, members of the Board of Commissioners, members of the Board of Directors, or Main Shareholders of the Company  
not having any business relationship, either directly or indirectly related to the Company's business activities  
- having high integrity, ability, knowledge, and experience in accordance with his/her field of work  
- having the ability to communicate, cooperate, and be committed to carry out his/her duties and responsibilities  
- complying with the Company's Code of Conduct

The Company does not have any members of the Risk Management Committee who were previously employees or partners of the Company's external auditors in the last 2 (two) years. [ACGS(P)E.3.1.]

# Pengangkatan, Pemberhentian, dan Masa Jabatan

# Komite Manajemen Risiko

# Appointment, Dismissal, and Term of Office of

# the Risk Management Committee

Anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko diangkat dan diberhentikan oleh Dewan Komisaris.

Masa jabatan Komite Manajemen Risiko adalah sesuai dengan命名为 jabatan Dewan Komisaris dan dapat dipilih kembali berdasarkan keputusan sirkuler rapat Dewan Komisaris.

Keanggotaan Komite Manajemen Risiko berakhir dalam hal tidak diyangkat kembali oleh Dewan Komisaris, anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko tersebut mengundurkan diri, mencgal dunia, diberhentikan oleh Dewan Komisaris, atasidak memenuhi persyaratan perundang-undangan yang berlaku.

Tata cara pengangkatan, penggantian, pemberhentian, atas pengunduran diri anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko Perseroan dilakukan tersebut dengan Piagam Komite Manajemen Risiko Perseroan.

Members of the Risk Management Committee are appointed and dismissed by the Board of Commissioners.

The term of office of the Risk Management Committee is in accordance with the term of office of the Board of Commissioners and can be reappointed based on the circular resolution of the Board of Commissioners.

The term of office of a member of the Risk Management Committee shall terminate in the event that he/she is not reappointed by the Board of Commissioners, he/she resigns, passes away, is dismissed by the Board of Commissioners, or does not fulfill the requirements of the applicable laws and regulations.

Procedures for the appointment, replacement, dismissal, or resignation of members of the Company's Risk Management Committee are performed by the Charter of the Risk Management Committee of the Company.

# Independensi Komite Manajemen Risiko

Setiap anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko Perseroan adalah pihak independen yang telah memenuhi persyaratan umum untuk diangkat sebagai anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko dan telah mencyawan independensinya pada tanggal 29 Mei 2024.

# Meetings of the Risk Management Committee

The meeting of the Risk Management Committee is held regularly, at least once every 4 (four) months. The meeting is considered valid if attended by the majority of the Risk Management Committee members, including the chairperson of the Risk Management Committee.

The resolution of the Risk Management Committee meeting shall be taken based on deliberation to reach a consensus. In the event deliberation for consensus is not achieved, the resolution shall be made based on the majority vote.

The resolutions of each Risk Management Committee meeting were stated in the minutes of the meeting, which were signed by all members of the Risk Management Committee present at the meeting, and are submitted in writing to the Board of Commissioners.

In 2024, the Risk Management Committee held 6 (six) meetings, with an average attendance rate of  $100\%$ .

# Peningkatan Kompetensi bagi Anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko

Perseroan mendorong setiap anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko untuk berpartisipasi secara aktif dalam pelatihan sekurangkurangnya 1 (satu) kali dalam setahun, dengan durasi pelatihan minimal selama 12 (dua belas) jam. Pelatihan ini dimaksudkan agar setup anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko tetap memahami perkembangan terkini erkait tren, kebikan, peraturan,{serta teknik manajemen risiko yang relevant, agar anggota Komite Manajemen Risiko dapat menjalankan tugasnya dengan lebih efektif dalam mendukung tercapainya tujuan perusahaan secara terukur dan berkelanjutan.

Lokakarya/pelatihan/ Seminar yang telah diikuti oleh Bapak F.X. Sutijastoto, Ibu Evita Herawati Legowo, dan Bapak Hendrikus Passagi pada tahun 2024 dapat dilihat pada bagian Govnansi Korporat, sub-bagian Dewan Komisaris.

# Competency Development for Members of the Risk Management Committee

The Company encourages each member of the Risk Management Committee to actively participate in training at least once a year, with a minimum training duration of 12 (twelve) hours. This training is intended so that each member of the Risk Management Committee remains updated on the latest developments related to trends, policies, regulations, and relevant risk management techniques, enabling the members of the Risk Management Committee to perform their duties more effectively in supporting the achievement of the company's goals measurably and sustainably.

Workshop/training/ Seminar attended by Mr. F.X. Sutijastoto, Mrs. Evita Herawati Legowo, and Mr. Hendrikus Passagi in 2024 can be seen in the Corporate Governance Section, Board of Commissioners subsection.

# Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi

[ACGS E.2.8.] [ACGS E.2.13.]

Nomination and Remuneration Committee ACGS E.2.8. AC6S E.2.13

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi adalah organ pendukung Perseroan yang dibentuk dan bertanggung jawab kepada Dewan Komisaris, dengan tugas utama membantu Dewan Komisaris dalam melaksanan fungsi terkait nominasi dan remunerasi.

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi bekerja sama dengan berbagai pihak, termasuk Direksi dan pihak manajemen terkait, untuk memperoleh informasi yang relevant dalam proses pengambilan keputusan nominasi dan remunerasi yang objektif dan memastikan Bahwa kebikan yang ditetapkan telah memenuhi standar industri dan peraturan yang berlaku.

# Piagam Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi

[ACGS.E.2.11] [ACGS.E.2.16.]

Piagam Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi berfungsi sebagai panduan bagi Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi dalam menjalankan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya untuk mendukung pelaksanaan fungsi nominasi dan remunerasi oleh Dewan Komisaris.

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi Perseroan pertama kali dibentuk melalui Keputusan Dewan Komisaris pada tanggal 18 Juni 2019. Untuk memberikan fokus yang lebih mendalam pada masingmasing fungsi, Perseroan menuysun 2 (dua) piagam terpisah yang menjelaskan masing-masing fungsi, yaitu Piagam Komite Nominasi dan Piagam Komite Remunerasi, yang keduanya diterbitkan pada 12 Desember 2019.

Piagam Komite Nominasi dan Piagam Komite Remunerasi memuat hal-hal sebagai berikut:

Landasan Hukum  
Nilai dan Etika  
Komposisi dan Kriteria  
Pengangkatan, Pemberhentian, dan Masa Jabatan  
Program Orientasi dan Pelatihan  
Tugas dan Tanggung Jawab  
Rapat  
Penilaian Kinerja  
Pelaporan  
Kerahasiaan  
Larangan  
Sanksi

Berlandaskan pada Piagam Komite Nominasi dan Piagam Komite Remunerasi, Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi diharapkan mampu menjalankan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya dengan baik dan efektif.

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee is the supporting organ of the Company established by and responsible to the Board of Commissioners, with the main tasks of assisting the Board of Commissioners in carrying out the nomination and remuneration functions.

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee collaborates with various parties, including the Board of Directors and relevant management, to obtain relevant information to make objective nomination and remuneration decisions and to ensure that the established policies meet industry standards and applicable regulations.

# Charter of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee [ACGS E.2.11] [ACGS E.2.16]

The Charter of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee is a guideline for the Nomination and Remuneration Committee to carry out its duties and responsibilities to support the implementation of the nomination and remuneration functions of the Board of Commissioners.

The Company's Nomination and Remuneration Committee was first established based on the Resolution of the Company's Board of Commissioners dated June 18, 2019. To provide a deeper focus on each function, the Company has prepared 2 (two) separate charters to describe the implementation of the nomination and remuneration functions, namely the Charter of the Nomination Committee and the Charter of the Remuneration Committee, both charters were issued on December 12, 2019.

The Charter of the Nomination Committee and the Charter of the Remuneration Committee cover the following items:

Legal Basis  
Values and Ethics  
Composition and Criteria  
Appointment, Dismissal, and Term of Office  
Orientation and Training Programs  
Duties and Responsibilities  
Meetings  
Performance Evaluation  
Reporting  
Confidentiality  
Prohibitions  
Sanction

By the Charter of the Nomination Committee and the Charter of the Remuneration Committee, the Nomination and Remuneration Committee is expected to carry out its duties and responsibilities properly and effectively.

Kedua piagam tersebut telah dipublikasikan di situs web Perseroan dan akan dievaluasi serta diperbarui secara Berkala seksuai dengan kebutuhan.

Both charters have been published on the Company's website and will be evaluated periodically as necessary.

# Tugas dan Tanggung Jawab

# Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi

# Duties and Responsibilities of

# the Nomination and Remuneration Committee

Tugas dan tanggung jawab Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi diatur di dalam Piagam Komite Nominasi dan Piagam Komite Remunerasi Perseroan.

# Tugas

Fungsi Nominasi  
- memastikan Bahwa masing-masing anggota Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan Komite memiliki kasitas yang memadai untuk memegang jabatan  
- menjaga independensi Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan Komite dengan makukutan peninjuan secara bergala atas masa jabatan dan potensi konflik kepentingan dari masing-masing anggota dalam melaksanan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya  
- memberikan rekomendasi kepada Dewan Komisaris menjadi jujliah dan komposisi anggota Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, Komite, dan Unit-Unit Pendukung, kebikan dan kriteria dalam proses nominasi, ada kebikan dan kriteria evaluasi kinerja bagi anggota Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, Komite, dan Unit-Unit Pendukung  
- membrantu Dewan Komisaris dalam melakukan penilaian kinerja anggota Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, Komite, dan Unit-Unit Pendukung berdasarkan tolok ukur yang telah disusun  
- memberikan rekomendasi kepada Dewan Komisaris mengai program pengembangan kompetensi anggota Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, Komite, dan Unit-Unit Pendukung  
- memberikan usulan mengai calon yang memenuhi syarat untuk diangkat sebagai anggota Direksi dan/atau Dewan Komisaris kepada Dewan Komisaris untuk disampaikan kepada RUPS  
- melakukan evaluasi persyaratan calon suksesi direktur yang diajukan oleh Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, Pengendali, dan/atau Pemegang Saham Utama  
- memberi reckomendasi mentoring dan pelatihan bagi calon suksesi direktur dan melakukan penelaahan berkata terhadap perkembangan calon suksesi direktur (jika diperlukan)  
- memberikan rekomendasi calon suksesi direktur kepada Dewan Komisaris untuk diajukan dalam RUPS (jika calon suksesi direktur dapat melalui proses nominasi)

Fungsi Remunerasi

- memastikan pemberian remunerasi yang terukur terhadap kriteria kinerja dan selaras dengan kepentingan jangka panjang perusahaan  
- memberikan rekomendasi kepada Dewan Komisaris mengai struktur, kebikan, dan bescharan remunerasi anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi  
- membrantu Dewan Komisaris dalam aktivukan penilaian kinerja dengan kesesuaian remunerasi yang diterima masing-masing anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi

# Tanggung Jawab

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi bertanggung jawab kepada Dewan Komisaris dan wajib bertindak secara independen dalam melaksananakan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya.

Duties and responsibilities of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee are stipulated in the Company's Charter of the Nomination Committee and Charter of the Remuneration Committee.

# Duties

- Nomination Function

- ensure that each member of the Board of Commissioners, the Board of Directors, and Committees has adequate capacity to hold the position  
- maintain the independency of the Board of Commissioners, Directors, and Committees by periodically reviewing the term of office and potential conflicts of interest of each member in carrying out their duties and responsibilities  
provide recommendations to the Board of Commissioners regarding the numbers and compositions of members of the Board of Directors, the Board of Commissioners, Committees, and Supporting Units, the policy and criteria used in the nomination process, as well as the policy and criteria used for performance evaluation of members of the Board of Directors, the Board of Commissioners, Committees, and Supporting Units  
- assist the Board of Commissioners in evaluating the performance of members of the Board of Directors, the Board of Commissioners, Committees, and Supporting Units, according to benchmarks that have been prepared  
- provide recommendations on competency development programs for members of the Board of Directors, the Board of Commissioners, Committees, and Supporting Units  
- provide recommendations to the Board of Commissioners regarding qualified candidates to be appointed as members of the Board of Directors and/or Board of Commissioners, to be submitted to the GMS  
- evaluate the requirements for the prospective candidates for Board of Directors succession submitted by the Board of Directors, the Board of Commissioners, Controllers, and/or Main Shareholders  
- provide mentoring and training recommendations for the Board of Directors succession candidates as well as conduct a periodic review of the development of candidates for the Board of Directors succession (if necessary)  
- provide candidate recommendations for the Board of Directors succession to the Board of Commissioners to be submitted to the GMS (if the candidate for the Board of Directors succession passes the nomination process)

- Remuneration Function

- ensure the provision of remuneration that is measurable against performance criteria and in line with the company's long-term interests  
provide recommendations to the Board of Commissioners regarding the structure, policy, and amount of remuneration for members of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors  
- assist the Board of Commissioners in conducting performance evaluation by the remuneration received by each member of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors

# Responsibilities

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee is responsible to the Board of Commissioners and shall act independently in carrying out its duties and responsibilities.

# Susunan Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi terdiri dari sedikitnya 3 (tiga) orang anggota, dengan ketentuan sebagai berikut:

- satur orang Komisaris Independen bertindak sebagai ketua  
- anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi lainnya dapat berasal dari:

- anggota Dewan Komisaris Perseroan

# Composition of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee shall consist of at least 3 (three) members, with the following provisions:

one Independent Commissioner acting as the chairperson  
- other members of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee may come from:

- a member of the Company's Board of Commissioners

- pihak yang berasal dari luar Perseroan, dengan ketentuan bahwa pihak tersebut memenuhi syarat-syarat sebagai berikut:

- tidy mempunyai hubungan affiliasi dengan Perseroan, anggota Direksi, anggota Dewan Komisaris, Pengendali, dan/atau Pemegang Saham Utama Perseroan  
- memiliki integritas tinggi dan memiliki kemampuan dan pengalaman yang memadai dan relevant untuk melaksanakan fungsi nominasi  
- tidyak merangkap jabatan sebagai anggota komite lainnya dalam Perseroan

- manager di bawah direktur yang membidangi SDM, dengan ketentuan bukan merupakan mayoritas anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi

Anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi Perseroan mayoritas merupakan pihak independen non eksekutif, yang bersal dari komisaris independen (sebagai ketua) dan pihak yang bersal dari luar perseasaan. [ACGS E.2.9. ACGS E.2.10. ACGS E.2.14. ACGS E.2.15.

Susunan dan jujiah anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi Perseroan juga ditentukan dengan mempertimbangkan berbagai faktor, termasuk pertumbuhan skala bisnis Perseroan dan keberagaman keahlian dan pengalaman agar komite dapat memberikan kontribusi yang maksimal bagi kemajuan Perseroan.

Sehubungan dengan berakhirnyaasajabatan anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi, pada tanggal 25 Juni 2024, Perseroan telah secara resmi menggangkat kembali anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi. Informasi terkait pengangkatan anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi ini tetlah diumumkan dalam keterbukaan informasi Perseroan tanggal 26 Juni 2024.

Dengan pengangkatan kembali tersebut, susunan Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi Perseroan telah menjadi berikut: ACGS(B)E.2.1.

- a person from outside the Company, provided that he/she meets the following requirements:

not having an affiliated relationship with the Company, the Company's members of the Board of Directors, members of the Board of Commissioners, Controllers, and/or Main Shareholders  
having high integrity as well as sufficient and relevant ability and experience to carry out the nomination function  
having no concurrent position in other committees in the Company

manager who is structurally under the director in charge of HR, provided that he/she does not constitute the majority of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee

The majority of members of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee of the Company are independent non-executive parties, originating from independent commissioners (as the chairperson) and a party from outside the company. [AC6S E.2.9. [AC6S E.2.10.]

# Prosedur Penilaian

Prosedur penilaian kinerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi dimulai dengan penilaian diri dengan mengisi formulir penilaian standar. Hasil penilaian diri diserahkan kepada Sekretaris Perusahaan untuk dirangkum dan disampaikan kepada Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi untuk dievaluasi lebih lanjut dan dibahas dalam rapat nominasi. Hasil penilaian kinerja dokumunikasikan dengan Direksi dan akan digunakan sebagai rekomendasi proses remunerasi dan rekomendasi pengembanganan kompetensi untuk anggota Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, komite, dan unit-unit pendukung Perseroan.

Prosedur penilaian dan proses evaluasi kinerja Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Perseroan berlaku juga untuk komite dan unit-unit pendukung Perseroan.

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi berperan untuk memastikan bahwa juliah, susunan, dan keberagaman Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris sesuai dengan kebutuhan Perseroan untuk menjamin efektivitas pengawasan dan pengelolaan Perseroan.

Dewan Komisaris dapat melibatkan konsultan independen dalam memfasilitasi pelaksanaan penilaian kinerja Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, komite, dan unit-unit pendukung Perseroan.

Penilaian diri dan penilaian kolektif Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, Komite, dan Unit-Unit Pendukung untuk kinerja tahun 2024 telah dilakukan pada bulan Februi 2025.

Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi telah makukan evaluasi terhadap dapat penilaian diri dan penilaian molektif tersebut serta telah menuysun rencana pengembangan kompetensi untuk Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, Komite, dan Unit-Unit Pendukung - selaras dengan arah strategi perusahaan yang terus Berkembang, untuk memastikan kepada Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, Komite, dan unit-unit pendukung memiliki kompetensi yang relevant dan dapat mendukung pencapaian tujuan jangka panjang perusahaan. Hasil evaluasi tersebut akan dijadakan dasar pertimbangan untuk mengajukan rekomendasi remunerasi kepada Dewan Komisaris, yang kemudian akan diusulkan pada RUPST.

[GRI 2-20-a] [ACGS(B)E.2.2.]

The criteria considered in the collective performance evaluation, among others, are:

- understanding of the Company's business operations, culture, vision, mission, strategies, and business plans  
understanding of his/her responsibilities, authorities, and priority of duties  
- the effectiveness of the compositions of the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, Committees, and Supporting Units in performing their duties and responsibilities

# Evaluation Procedure

The performance evaluation procedure for the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors begins with self-evaluation where each member completes a standard evaluation form. Results from self-evaluation are then submitted to the Corporate Secretary to be summarized and submitted to the Nomination and Remuneration Committee to be reviewed and discussed in the nomination meeting. The results of the performance evaluation are communicated to the Board of Directors and will be used as recommendations for the remuneration process as well as recommendations for competency development for members of the Company's Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, committees, and supporting units.

The performance evaluation procedure used for the Company's Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors also applies to the Company's committees and supporting units.

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee plays a role in ensuring that the number, composition, and diversity of the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors follow the needs of the Company to ensure the effectiveness of the Company's supervision and management.

The Board of Commissioners may involve independent consultants in facilitating the implementation of performance evaluations of the Company's Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, committees, and supporting units.

The self-evaluation and collective evaluation of the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, Committees, and Supporting Units for their performance in 2024 were conducted in February 2025.

The Nomination and Remuneration Committee has evaluated the results of the self-assessment and collective assessment and has developed a competency development plan for the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, Committees, and Supporting Units - in line with the continuously evolving company strategy, to ensure that the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, Committees, and supporting units possess relevant competencies and can support the achievement of the company's long-term goals. The results of the evaluation will serve as the basis for proposing remuneration recommendations to the Board of Commissioners, which will then be submitted to the AGM. [GRI 2-20-a] [ACGS (B)E.2.2.]

Kebijakan, struktur, dan besaran remunerasi dievaluasi sedikitnya 1(satu) kal dalam setahun dengan mempertimbangkan:

- kinerja Perseroan  
- remunerasi pembanding yang berlaku pada industri nasonial yang relevant dan/atau perusahaan lain dengan skala yang mirip dan kondisi perekonomian global  
tugas, tanggung jawab, dan wewenang anggota Direksi dan/atau Dewan Komisaris yang dikaitkan dengan pencapaian tujuan dan kinerja Perseroan  
- pencapaian target kinerja masing-masing anggota Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris  
- keseimbangan antara komponen tetap dan komponen variabel dari remunerasi

Untuk menjag independensi dan/atau kepada kemungkanan terjadinya benturan kepada, Perseroan menetapkan kejibakan/praktik terkit remunerasi untuk Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi sebagai berikut: [GRI 2-10-b]

[GRI 2-15-a] [GRI 2-19-a] [GRI 2-19-b] [ACGS D.3.3.] [ACGS(P)E.4.2.]

The policy, structure, and amount of remuneration are evaluated at least once a year by considering:

the Company's performance  
- remuneration benchmarks from relevant national industries and/or other companies of similar size as well as global economic conditions  
- duties, responsibilities, and authorities of the member of the Board of Directors and/or the Board of Commissioners, concerning the achievement of the Company's goals and performance  
- achievement of performance targets for each member of the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissioners  
balance between the fixed and variable components of the remuneration

To maintain independence and/or to avoid the possibility of conflict of interest, the Company established the following policies/practices related to remuneration for the Board of Commissioners and Board of Directors: [GRI]

2-10-b][GRI 2-15-a][GRI 2-19-a][GRI 2-19-b][ACGS D.3.3.[ACGS(P)E.4.2.]

- Anggota Direksi menerima remunerasi dalam pentuk gaji, tunjangan, bonus kinerja, dan/atau benefit lainnya sehabungan dengan tugas dan tanggung jawab sebagai Direksi. Anggota Direksi tidak menerima tambahan remunerasi lain secara terpisah dari remunerasi yang diterima sehabungan dengan tugas dan tanggung jawab sebagai Direksi.  
- Anggota Dewan Komisaris, termasuk Komisaris Independen, menerima remunerasi tetap dalam pentuk honorarium sesuai persetujuan RUPS. Anggota Dewan Komisaris, termasuk Komisaris Independen, tidak menerima hak opsi, bonus saham, ataupun insentif lainnya.  
- Anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Perseroan dilarang untuk mengambil dan/atau menerima keuntungan pribadi (termasuk untuk mendapatkan pinjaman dari Perseroan) Selain remunerasi dan fasilitas lainnya yang telah ditetapkan.

Terkait dengan kebikan ini, tidak ada anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Perseroan yang mendapatkan pinjaman dari Perseroan. [ACGS A.8.3.]

Perseroan tidak memiliki kebijakan penghargaan/kompensasi yang memerhitungkan kinerja perusahaan di luar ukuran keuangan jangka pendek. Perseroan juga tidak memiliki standar terukur untuk menyelaraskan remunerasi berbasis kinerja untuk direktur eksekutif dan eksekutif senior dengan kepentingan jangka panjang perusahaan, seprosi provisi clawback dan bonus yang ditangguhkan. [ACGS C.6.3.] [ACGS E.3.13.]

Perseroan tidak memiliki pejabat eksekutif tertinggi yang bukan merupakan anggota Direksi, sehingga Perseroan tidak memiliki kebjikan/praktik terkait remunerasi direktur eksekutif dan pejabat eksekutif tertinggi yang bukan merupakan anggota Direksi. [ACGS D.3.4.]

Dalam RUPST Perseroan tanggal 25 Juni 2024, pemegang saham Perseroanmenytujui untuk memberikan kewenangan kepada Dewan Komisaris untukmenentukan berasan remunerasi yang diterima oleh masing-masing anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi untuk tahun 2024. Keputusan RUPST tersebut sudah ditindaklanjuti oleh Dewan Komisaris. [GRI 2-20-a-ji,b] [ACGS E.3.12.]

Pada tahun 2024, total remunerasi yang diterima oleh Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi Perseroan adalah sebesar USD 4.658.922. Remunerasi Dewan Komisaris diberikan dalam bentuk honorarium tetap. Sedangkan remunerasi Direksi diberikan dengan mempertimbangkan pencapaian kinerja Perseroan dan target kinerja masing-masing anggota Direksi di setup bisnis yang dimiliki Perseroan. Secara umum, Perseroan berhasil mempertahakan kinerja baik di tengah penurunan hari相对较 bela dan untuk jukkan peningkatan kinerja yangcekup baik dari bisnis-bisnis lain. [ACGS(B)C.1.6.]

- Members of the Board of Directors receive remuneration in the form of salary, allowances, performance bonuses, and/or other benefits. Members of the Board of Directors do not receive additional remuneration separately from the remuneration received in connection with their duties and responsibilities as Directors.  
- Members of the Board of Commissioners, including the Independent Commissioners, receive fixed remuneration in the form of honorarium as approved by the GMS. Members of the Board of Commissioners, including the Independent Commissioners, do not receive any options, share bonuses, or other incentives.  
- Members of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors of the Company are prohibited from taking and/or receiving personal benefits (including obtaining loans from the Company) other than the remuneration and other benefits that have been determined.

Under this policy, there were no members of the Company's Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors who obtained loans from the Company. ACGSA.8.3.

The Company does not have a reward/compensation policy that accounts for the performance of the company beyond short-term financial measures. The Company also does not have measurable standards to align the performance-based remuneration of the executive directors and senior executives with the long-term interest of the Company, such as clawback provisions and deferred bonuses. [ACGS C.6.3.] [ACGS E.3.13.]

The Company does not have a chief executive officer who is not a member of the Board of Directors. Therefore, the Company does not have a policy/practice regarding remuneration for executive directors and a chief executive officer who are not members of the Board of Directors. [AC6S D.3.4.]

In the Company's AGM dated June 25, 2024, the shareholders of the Company agreed to grant authority to the Board of Commissioners to determine the amount of remuneration received by each member of the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors for the year 2024. The AGM resolution had been followed up by the Board of Commissioners. [GR]

2-20-a-ii,b [ACGS E.3.12.]

In 2024, the total remuneration received by the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors was USD 4,658,922. Remuneration for the Board of Commissioners was given in the form of a fixed honorarium. Meanwhile, Directors' remuneration was given by considering the Company's performance achievements and the performance targets of each member of the Board of Directors in each business owned by the Company. In general, the Company succeeded in maintaining good performance despite the decline in coal market prices and showed a fairly good increase in performance from other businesses. [ACGS(B)C.1.6.]

# The Board of Directors' Succession Policy

# GRI 2-10-a[ACGS.E.5.3]

Pada umumnya, Perseroan seksutuk dan pesdaran kandidat anggota Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan Komite berdasarkan酥er informasi internal Perseroan dan/atau internal grup perusahaan. Perseroan tidak melibatkan sama pesdaran profesifai atta sumber kandidat eksternal lain untuk mencari kandidat untuk anggota Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan Komite. ACGS(B).E.3.1.

Dengan bantuan Presiden Direktur dan Direktur yang membidangi SDM, Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi memiliki peranan pentangalam melakukan perencanaan suksesi karyawan kunci, termasuk suksesi Direksi. Perencanaan suksesi karyawan kunci ini dimaksudkan untuk menjaga kesinambungan kepermimpinan dalam Perseroan. Rencana pengembangan dan suksesi dapat ditinja secara berkala oleh Dewan Komisaris.

Kriteria yang dipertimbangkan dalam prosedur suksesi disesuaikan dengan kriteria untuk masing-masing posisi yang dibutuhkan. Adapun kriteria penggangkatan Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, Komite Audit, Komite Manajemen Risiko, dan Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi dapat dilihat pada bagian Governansi Corporat, sub-bagian Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi - Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, Komite Audit, Komite Manajemen Risiko, dan Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi.

In general, the Company searches for candidates for members of the Board of Commissioners, Directors, and Committees based on internal information sources of the Company and/or internal group companies. The Company does not involve professional search firms or other external candidate sources when seeking candidates for members of the Board of Commissioners, the Board of Directors, and Committees. [ACGS(B)E.3.1.]

With the assistance of the President Director and the Director in charge of HR, the Nomination and Remuneration Committee has an important role in planning key employees' succession, including the Board of Directors' succession. The key employees' succession plan aims to maintain the continuity of leadership within the Company. Such development and succession plans may be reviewed periodically by the Board of Commissioners.

The criteria considered in the succession procedure are adjusted to the criteria for each required position. The appointment criteria for the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, Audit Committee, Risk Management Committee, and Nomination and Remuneration Committee can be seen in the Corporate Governance section, the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, Audit Committee, Risk Management Committee, and Nomination and Remuneration Committee sub-sections.

# Rapat Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi

Rapat Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi diadakan secara berkala, minimal 1 (satu) kali dalam 4 (empat) bulan. Undangan rapat disampaikan oleh ketua Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi.

Keputusan dalam rapat Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi diambil melalui musyawarah untuk mencapai mufakat. Jika mufakat tidak tercapai, keputusan ditetapkan berdasarkan suara terbanyak.

Selama tahun 2024, Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi telah melaksanakan 7 (tujuh) kaliRAPAT. Tingkat kehadiranRAPAT Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi pada tahun 2024 secara rata-rata adalah  $100\%$ . [ACGS E.2.12. ACGS E.2.17.]

Keputusan setiapRAPATKomiteNominasi danRemunerasi dituangkan dalam risalahrapat yang ditandatangani seluruh anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi yang hadir dalam rapat, dan disampaikan secara tertulis kepada Dewan Komisaris.

# Meetings of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee

The meeting of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee shall convene a meeting regularly, at least once every 4 (four) months. Invitation of the meeting shall be conveyed by the chairperson of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee.

The resolution of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee metting shall be taken based on deliberation to reach a consensus. In the event deliberation for consensus is not achieved, the resolution shall be made based on the majority vote.

In 2024, the Nomination and Remuneration Committee had held 7 (seven) meetings. The average attendance rate of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee meetings held in 2024 was  $100\%$ .

ACGS.E.2.12.]ACGS.E.2.17.]

The resolutions of each Nomination and Remuneration Committee meeting were stated in the minutes of the meeting which were signed by all members of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee present at the meeting, and are submitted in writing to the Board of Commissioners.

Perseroan mendorong setiap anggota Komite Nominasi dan Remunerasi untuk berpartisipasi secara aktif dalam pelatihan sekurang-kurangnya 1 (satu) kali dalam setahun, dengan durasi pelatihan minimal selama 12 (dua belas) jam. # Unit Audit Internal

[ACGS E.3.14]

Internal Audit Unit ACGS E.3.14

Unit Audit Internal adalah unit kerja independen yang dibentuk oleh Perseroan untuk melindungi serta mencatkan nilai perusahaan melalui pelaksanaan kegiatan assurance berbasis risiko. Unit ini berperan mendukung Direksi dan manajemen dalam mengevaluasi pengelolaan serta pengendalian terhadap risiko-risiko yang memiliki dampak signifikan, sekalis gus memberikan rekomendasi dan masukan erkait governansi korporat, manajemen risiko, serta systemd pengendalian internal.

# Piagam Unit Audit Internal

Piagam Unit Audit Internal merupakan pedoman bagi Unit Audit Internal untuk melaksananakahugas dan tanggung jawabnya.

Piagam Unit Audit Internal Perseroan pertama kali diterbitkan pada tahun 2011. Piagam tersebut kemudian disempurnakan pada tahun 2020.

Piagam Unit Audit Internal memuat hal-hal seksagai berikut:

Struktur dan Kedudukan  
Misi dan Tujuan  
Tugas, Wewenang, dan Tanggung Jawab  
- Standar dan Kode Etik  
- Independensi dan Objektivitas  
Persyaratan Auditor Internal  
- Program Asurans dan Peningkatan Kualitas

Dengan berpedoman pada Piagam Unit Audit Internal, Unit Audit Internal diharapkan dapat melaksanakan tugas dan tanggung jawabnya secara efektif.

Piagam Unit Audit Internal telah dipublikasikan di situs web Perseroan dan akan ditinjau secara bergala sebagaimana diperlukan.

The Internal Audit Unit is an independent work unit established by the Company to protect and enhance its values by carrying out risk-based assurance activities. This unit assists the Board of Directors and management in evaluating and controlling the most significant risks, simultaneously providing advice and input regarding the Company's corporate governance, risk management, and internal control system.

# Charter of the Internal Audit Unit

The Charter of the Internal Audit Unit is a guideline for the Internal Audit Unit to carry out its duties and responsibilities.

The Company's Charter of the Internal Audit Unit was first issued in 2011. It was then updated in 2020.

The Charter of the Internal Audit Unit covers the following items:

Structure and Position  
Mission and Purpose  
Duties, Authorities, and Responsibilities  
- Standards and Code of Conduct  
Independence and Objectivity  
- Requirements of Internal Auditors  
Assurance and Quality Improvement Programs

By referring to the Internal Audit Unit Charter, the Internal Audit Unit is expected to carry out its duties and responsibilities effectively.

The charter of the Internal Audit Unit has been published on the Company's website and will be reviewed periodically as necessary.

# Tugas, Wewenang, dan Tanggung Jawab Unit Audit Internal

# Duties, Authorities, and Responsibilities of the Internal Audit Unit

Tugas, wewenang, dan tanggung jawab Unit Audit Internal diatur dalam Piagam Unit Audit Internal.

# Tugas

Unit Audit Internal bertanggung jawab dalam melaksanakan tugas-tugas sebagai berikut:

- memeriksa dan mengevaluasi bukti secara objektif untuk memberikan penilaian independen tidak tentang kecukupan dan efektivitas proses tata kelola, manajemen risiko, dan pengendalian internal  
- melakukan audit internal bergala, investigasi, pemeriksaan, dan penilaianatas efisiensi di efektivitas di bidang keuangan, akuntansi, operasional, sumber daya manusia, pemasaran, tekologi informasi, dan kegiatan lainnya  
- seksual: melakukan audit tahunan, audit khusus, audit mendadak, dan audit atas fungsi/departemen

Duties, authorities, and responsibilities of the Internal Audit Unit are stipulated in the Charter of the Internal Audit Unit.

# Duties

The Internal Audit Unit is responsible for carrying out the following duties:

- examine and evaluate evidence objectively to provide an independent assessment of the adequacy and effectiveness of governance, risk management, and internal control processes  
- undertake regular internal audits, investigations, examinations, and assessments of the efficiency and effectiveness of finance, accounting, operations, human resources, marketing, information technology, and other activities  
- undertake annual audits, special audits, surprise audits, and audits on function/department

- seksual
- melakukan audit linewidth pengunut dan hal terjadi penyimpangan selama audit normal atas dasar pengambilan sampel  
- melakukan evaluasi kepadahan terhadap persyaratan hukum, regulasi, kebjikan, dan prosedur  
- mangevaluasi kepadahan dan efektivitas prosedur operasional standar yang ada dan memberikan rekomendasi perbaikan  
- memastikan Bahwa sumber daya dipereleh secara ekonomis, digunakan secara efisien, dan difaja secara memadai  
- melaksanakan investigasi khusus yang ditugaskan oleh Dewan Komisaris, Komite Audit, dan/atau Presiden Direktur sebagaimana diperlukan

# Wewenang

Unit Audit Internal berwenang untuk hal-hal sebagai berikut:

- memiliki akses tidak terbatas ke semua departemen, kantor, afliasi, aktivitas, catatan, pembukuan, akun, informasi, system, properti, dan personnel dalam perusahaan yang relevan dengan kinerja fungsi audit setiap sudah  
- mendapatkan bantuan yang diperlukan dari personnel di berbagai departemen, kantor, dan affilasi di dalam unit tempat tim audit melakukan audit  
- mendapatkan bantuan dari spezialis, profesional, dan lainnya jika dianggap perlu dari dalam kepada laru perusahaan  
- makukan komunikasi langsung dengan Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan/atau Komite Audit serta anggota dari Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan/atau Komite Audit  
-pekukan pertemuan rutin dan insidentil dengan Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan/atau Komite Audit  
- melakukan koordinasi dengan kegiatan auditor eksternal

# Tanggung Jawab

Tanggung jawab Unit Audit Internal adalah sebagai berikut:  
- mengusulkan rencana audit tahunan dengan fokus audit berbasis risiko dan memperhatikan risiko potensial yang teridentifikasi kepada Presiden Direktur dan Komite Audit untuk ditinjau dan disetujui, kemudian menerapkan rencana tersebut termasuk tugasa proyek khusus yang diminta oleh Presiden Direktur dan/atau Komite Audit  
- [{engkunikasikan dampak dari keterbatasan sumber daya pada suatu rencana audit dengan Presiden Direktur dan Komite Audit]  
- memastikan aktivitas audit internal memiliki akses ke sumber daya yang seksuai terkait kompetensi dan keterampilan  
- mengelola aktivitas dengan kepada untuk memenuhi misinya  
- memberikan saran perbaikan dan informasi yang objektif inginatan yang diperiksa pada semua tingkat manajemen  
- menuiapkan laporan audit untuk disampaikan kepada Presiden Direktur dan Komite Audit  
- membrantu dalam penyelidikan dan pemeriksaan aktivitas signifikan yang teridentifikasi terdapat kecukangan dan melaporkan telah penyelidikan dan pemeriksaan tersebut but tetada Presiden Direktur dan Komite Audit  
- memastikan Bahwa manajemen menerapkan perbaikan kontrol, makukan tindakan korektif yang disepakati, dan makukan tindak lanjat yang dianggap perlu oleh Unit Audit Internal seara memadai, efektif, dan tepat faktu  
- memantau, menganalisis, dan melaporkan pelaksanaan perbaikan yang direkomendasikan sebelumnya  
- mengui, mangevaluasi, dan tidak pelaksanaan, kecukupan, dan efektivitas pengendalian internal danSYSTEM manajemen risikoSESuai dengan bekijiban Perseroan  
- melakukan jasa konsultasi dan memberi nasihatteringtata kelola, manajemen risiko, dan pengendalian yang sesuai  
- melaporkan tujuan, wewenang, tanggung jawab, dan kinerja aktivitas audit internal kerkit dengan rencana kerja audit secara berkala kepada Presiden Direktur dan Komite Audit  
- memastikan kesesuaian dengan standar yang diterbitkan oleh Institute of Internal Auditors  
- memastikan staft audit profesional yang memiliki pengetahunan, keterampilan, dan pengalaman yang@cukup untuk memenuhi persyaratan sebagai auditor internal  
- seksutif dan jika diperlukan dengan penyedia asurans lainnya  
- mencinformasikan kepada Komite Audit mengenai tren dan perkembangan yang muncul dalam praktik audit internal dan memberikan rekomendasi perbaikan yang diperlukan dalam Piagam Unit Audit Internal  
- mengembangkan program untuk mencurveuasi kualitas kegiatan Unit Audit Internal

- carry out full-scope audits when irregularities are detected on a sampling basis during the normal audit  
- evaluate adherence to legal requirements, regulations, policies, and procedures  
- evaluate adherence to and effectiveness of existing standard operating procedures and provide recommendations for improvements  
- ensure that resources are acquired economically, utilized efficiently, and safeguarded adequately  
- undertake special investigations assigned by the Board of Commissioners, Audit Committee, and/or the President Director as necessary

# Authorities

The Internal Audit Unit maintains authority for the following matters:

have free and unrestricted access to all departments, offices, affiliates, activities, records, books, accounts, information, systems, properties, and personnel within the company that are relevant to the performance of audit function at any time  
- obtain the necessary assistance of personnel in various departments, offices, and affiliates within the unit where audit team is performing an audit  
- obtain assistance of specialists, professionals, and others where considered necessary from within or outside the company  
- communicate directly with the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, and/or Audit Committee and as well as members of the Board of Directors, Board of Commissioners, and/or Audit Committee  
- conduct regular and incidental meetings with the Board of Commissioners, Board of Directors, and/or the Audit Committee  
coordinate the activities of external auditors

# Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the Internal Audit Unit are as follows:  
- propose the annual audit plan using an appropriate risk-based focus audit and taking into consideration potential risks identified to the President Director and the Audit Committee for review and approval, then implement the plan including any special tasks or projects requested by the President Director and/or the Audit Committee  
- communicate the impact of resource limitations on the audit plan with the President Director and the Audit Committee  
- ensure the internal audit activity has access to appropriate resources with regard to competency and skill  
manage the activities appropriately to fulfill its mission  
- provide recommendations and objective information on the activities examined at all levels of management  
- prepare an audit report for submission to the President Director and the Audit Committee  
- assist in the investigation and examination of significant suspected fraudulent activities and report the results of the investigation and examination to the President Director and the Audit Committee  
- ensure that the management implements the agreed control improvements and corrective actions and performs such follow-up work as the Internal Audit Unit deems necessary in an adequate, effective, and timely manner  
- monitor, analyze, and report on the implementation of improvements previously recommended  
- test, evaluate, and assess the implementation, adequacy, and effectiveness of the internal control and risk management system by the Company's policies  
- perform appropriate consulting and provide advice related to governance, risk management, and control  
- report the internal audit activity's purpose, authority, responsibility, and performance relative to its audit plan periodically to the President Director and the Audit Committee  
- ensure conformance with the Standards published by the Institute of Internal Auditors  
- ensure the audit staff is a professional with sufficient knowledge, skills, and experience to meet the requirements as internal auditor.

cooperate with the Audit Committee and if necessary with other assurance providers  
- inform the Audit Committee on emerging trends and developments in internal auditing practices and give recommendations for improvement in the Charter of the Internal Audit Unit  
develop a program to evaluate the quality of Internal Audit Unit activities

# Kriteria Pengangkatan Auditor Internal

# Appointment Criteria for the Internal Auditor

Perseroan menetapkan persyaratan umum bagi orang perorangan untuk dapat diangkat sebagai auditor internal Perseroan, sebagai berikut:  
- memiliki integritas yang tinggi dan bertindak secara profesional, mandiri, jujur, dan objektif dalam melaksanakan tugasnya  
- memiliki pengetahunan dan pengalaman dalam teknik audit dan disiplin terkait lainnya yang diperlukan untuk tugas audit  
- memiliki pengetahunan tersebut perundang-undangan di bidang pasar modal dan peraturan kerkit lainnya  
- memiliki kemampuan untuk berinteraksi dan Berkumunikasi secara efektif baik secara lisan maupun tertulis  
- memenuhi standar profesjional yang dikeluarkan oleh Asosiasi Audit Internal dan/atau asosiasi/lembaga lainnya sebagaimana dibutuhkan  
- mematuhi Kode Etik Audit Internal  
-unjaga kerahasian informasi dan/atau data yang Berkaitan dengan kinerja Perseroan dalam melaksananakanugas dan tanggung jawabnya kecuali diwajibkan oleh undang-undang kepada diminta oleh putusan pengadilan  
- memahami prinsip governansi korporat yang baik, manajemen risiko, dan pengendalian internal  
- memiliki kesediaan menckatkan pengetahunan, keterampilan, dan kemampuan secara terus menerus  
- tidy merangkap tugas dan jabatan auditor internal dan/atau pelaksana kegiatan operasiional perusahaan dan/atau entitas anak

The Company has established general requirements for individuals to be appointed as members of the Company's internal auditors, as follows:  
- possess high integrity and act professionally, independently, honestly, and objectively in the conduct of their duties  
have knowledge and experience in audit techniques and other relevant disciplines required for audit duties  
have knowledge in the laws and regulations in the field of capital markets and other relevant regulations  
have the ability to interact and communicate effectively either verbally or in writing  
- comply with professional standards issued by the Internal Audit Association and/or other associations/institutions as necessary  
- comply with the Internal Audit's Code of Ethics  
- maintain the confidentiality of information and/or data related Company's performance in the conduct of its duties and responsibilities except when required by law or demanded by a court decision  
- understand the principles of good corporate governance, risk management, and internal control  
have willingness to increase the knowledge, skills, and abilities on a continuing basis  
have no concurrent duties and position of internal auditors and/or executors of operational company activities and/or their subsidiaries

# Implementation of Duties of the Internal Audit Unit in 2024

The Company and its subsidiaries conduct integrated internal audits periodically for each business process, including audits of operations, IT systems, finance, compliance, risk management, internal control, corporate governance, and other functions for all business cycles in the Company and its subsidiaries, such as the expenditure or procurement cycle, revenue, inventory, fixed assets, and IT systems. The results of the internal audit examination provide a comprehensive overview of risks, controls, and process improvement recommendations. The input provided includes suggestions for improving operational efficiency, IT system enhancements, and compliance.

The Internal Audit Unit has carried out its duties by the Charter of the Internal Audit Unit, such as conducting general audits based on the annual audit work plan, ad-hoc audits based on discussion results or requests from the Company's management, and the development of processes and systems within the Company and its subsidiaries. The Board of Directors provides full support and does not limit the scope or access of the Internal Audit Unit.

# Rapat Unit Audit Internal

Sesuai Peraturan OJK, Anggaran Dasar Perseroan, dan Piagam Unit Audit Internal,RAPAT Unit Audit Internal dilaksanakan secara berkala paling sedikit 1(satu) kali dalam 3(tiga) bulan.

Pada tahun 2024, Unit Audit Internal telah menjadi 3 (tiga) kaliRAPAT dengan Komite Audit dan 5 (lima) kali rapat dengan Direksiuntuk membahas update kegiatan Unit Audit Internal, dan 4 (empat)kali rapat dengan Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi untuk membahaslaporan keuangkan konsolidasian Perseroan dan entitasannya.

Agenda yang dibahas dalam rapat antara lain sebagai berikut:

- rencana kerja  
- perkembangan rencana audit tahunan  
- laporan keuangan  
status implementasi tindakan perbaikan, dan  
- hambatan dalam implementasi Piagam Unit Audit Internal (jika ada)

# Perbaikan Berkelenjutan bagi Unit Audit Internal

Untuk memastikan kualitas pengawasan dan pengendalian internal tetap optimalserta mendukung pencapaian tujuan Perseroan,Unit Audit Internal berencana untuk makukan perbaikan berkelanjutan sebagai berikut:

- mendukung Perseroan dengan memberikan jasa asurans dan konsultasi secara independen dan objektif atas tata kelola, kegiatan operasional, dan efektivitas pengendalian internal

To facilitate its activities, the Internal Audit Unit has been using IT as needed.

To ensure and continuously improve the quality of its audit, the Internal Audit Unit implements a quality assurance and improvement program that comprises the following:

conducting surveys to obtain feedback from the management

performing self-assessment and peer review on each audit assignment to ensure compliance with the applicable Internal Audit manual  
conducting self-assessment on conformance with International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing and compliance with the OJK regulations  
conducting continuous improvement programs to enhance the audit cycle time and productivity

The results of the assurance and quality improvement program were compiled and discussed to be included in a continuous improvement project for the following year. The results of this assurance and quality improvement program were reported to the Board of Directors and the Audit Committee regularly and received a positive review.

# Meetings of the Internal Audit Unit

In accordance with OJK Regulations, the Articles of Association of the Company, and the Charter of the Internal Audit Unit, the Internal Audit Unit meeting shall be conducted at least once in 3 (three) months.

In 2024, the Internal Audit Unit held 3 (three) meetings with the Audit Committee and 5 (five) meetings with the Board of Directors to discuss updates on the activities of the Internal Audit Unit, and 4 (four) meetings with the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Directors to discuss the consolidated financial statements of the Company and its subsidiaries.

The agenda discussed at the meeting included the following:

work plan  
progress of the annual audit plan  
financial reports  
status of corrective actions implementation, and  
- constraints in implementing the Charter of the Internal Audit Unit (if any)

Unit Audit Internal menyusun program pelatihan untuk memastikan kepada setiap anggota tim memiliki pengetahuan dan keahlian yang memadai untuk melaksanan tugas-tugasnya. Pada tahun 2024, setiap anggota tim mendapat pelatihan rata-rata 2 (dua) hari.

Lokakarya/pelatihan/ Seminar yang diikuti dapat dilihat pada tabel berikut:

significant added value and improve in various aspects of the Company's operational activities

- improve the risk-based audit process by priotizing the understanding and evaluation of previously identified potential risks, which allows the team to identify areas that require greater attention and enhance the effectiveness of risk mitigation  
- improve the competencies and skills of the Internal Audit Unit members by involving the Internal Audit Unit members in relevant workshops, trainings, and/or seminars, to ensure that each Internal Audit Unit member is ready to perform their duties with high professionalism in an ever-evolving business environment and increasingly complex challenges  
- maintain and improve the quality of assurance through a comprehensive improvement program, that covers all aspects of the internal audit activities

# Pengendalian Internal

Perseroan gunshot memahami因为她 tenerapan sistem pengendalian internal yang konsisten dan efektif merupakan sudah dapat elemen kunci dalam menjagae keberlanjutan operasional dan keberHASILAN jangka panjang. Sistem pengendalian internal yang kokoh adalah bagian integral dari infrastruktur governansi korporat yang dirancang tidak hatanya untuk mencegah dan mengidentifikasi potensi kecURLangan, tetapi juga untuk memastikan kepada setiap proses dan aktivitas di perusahaan berjalan secara efisien dan sesuai dengan standar yang ditapkan.

Bagi Perseroan, pengendalian internal juga bertujuan untuk menjaga keandalan pelaporan keuangan, yang merupakan aspek penting dalam transparansi dan akuntabilitas kepada pemangku kepentingan. Selain itu,SYSTEMINI bertujuan untuk melindungi aset perusahaanagar terhindar dari risiko kerugian,serta memastikan kepadahan terhadap peraturan dan regulasi yang berlaku,baik ditingkat nasional maupun internasional. Pengendalian internal tidak hanya berfungsi sebagai alat pengawasan,tetapi juga sebagai landasan untuk menciptakan proses yang transparan,akuntabel, dan berkelanjutan dalam setiap aspek kegiatan bisnis Perseroan.

Perseroan memiliki prosedur pengendalian internal dan makukan penelaahan secara Berkala untuk perbaikan dan penguatan pengendalian internal perusahaan. [ACGS E.3.17.]

# Penelaahan dan Peninjauan Transaksi

Sepanjang tahun 2024, Perseroan telah melaksanan sejumlah transaksi afliliasi dan/atau transaksi material yang dilakukan sesuai dengan ketentuan praktik bisnis yang lazim dan prinsip kewajaran transaksi. Beberapa di antaranya merupakan transaksi yang wajib dilaporkan kepada OJK dan/atau memerlukan persetujuan RUPS, namun tidak termasuk transaksi yang mengandung benturan kepentingan.

Rincian mengenaiNama pihak affiliasi/berelasi, hubungan, sifat, sama nilai transaksi material dengan pihak affiliasi/berelasi tercantum dalam laporan keuangan Perseroan pada bagian Transaksi dengan Pihak Berelasi, sebagai manfa dasajikan dalam Laporan Tahunan ini.[ACGS D.4.2.]

Perseroan telah melakukan keterbukaan informasi dan menyelenggarakan RUPS sesuai dengan peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlaku. Informasi mengenai keterbukaan informasi dan RUPS Perseroan sehubungan dengan transaksi yang dilakukan pada tahun 2024 dapat dilihat pada bagian Governansi Corporat, sub-bagian RUPS dan Keterbukaan Informasi dan pada bagian Analisis dan Pembahasan Manajemen, sub-bagian Peristiwa dan/atau Transaksi Material dan Pihak Berelasi.

# Internal Control

The Company fully understands that the implementation of a consistent and effective internal control system is one of the key elements in maintaining operational sustainability and long-term success. A robust internal control system is an integral part of the corporate governance infrastructure designed not only to prevent and identify potential fraud but also to ensure that every process and activity within the company runs efficiently and by established standards.

For the Company, internal control also aims to maintain the reliability of financial reporting, which is an important aspect of transparency and accountability to stakeholders. In addition, this system aims to protect the company's assets from the risk of loss, as well as ensure compliance with applicable regulations and laws, both at the national and international levels. Internal control not only functions as a tool for supervision but also serves as a foundation for creating transparent, accountable, and sustainable processes in every aspect of the Company's business activities.

The Company established sound internal control procedures and carries out regular reviews to improve and strengthen the company's internal controls. [ACGS E.3.17.]

# Review and Examination of Transactions

During 2024, the Company carried out several affiliated and/or material transactions which were conducted by generally accepted business practices and the arms-length principle. Several transactions were transactions that needed to be reported to the OJK and/or GMS approval but were not conflict-of-interest transactions.

The details regarding names of affiliated/related parties, relationships, nature, and value of material transactions with affiliated/related parties can be seen in the Company's financial statements in the Transactions with Related Parties section as attached to this Annual Report. [ACGS D.4.2.]

The Company has carried out information disclosure and held GMS following the prevailing laws and regulations. Information regarding information disclosure and the Company's GMS in connection with transactions carried out in 2024 can be seen in the Corporate Governance section, GMS and Information Disclosure sub-section and in the Management Discussion and Analysis section, Material and Related Party Transactions and/or Events sub-section.

# Pengendalian Internalatas Pelaporan Keuangan (ICFR)

Perseroan memiliki divisi pengendalian bisnis yang bertanggung jawab atas prosesICFR di Perseroan. Lingkup pekerjaan ICFR dilakukan berdasarkan pedoman yang diterbitkan oleh Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) yang terdiri atas 5(lima)komponen, yaitu: lingkungan pengendalian, penilaian risiko, kegiatan pengendalian,SYSTEM informasi dan komunikasi, serta pemantauan.

ICFR diterapkan untuk memastikan oleh keuang bersaaji secara andal serta laporan keuang interim dan tahunan disampaikan kepada waktu. Perseroan beserta entitas tidak wajib mematuhi ketentuan ICFR. Ketentuan ini juga berlaku bagi perusahaan asosiasi, operasi bersama, dan usaha patungan yang proses pembukuan dan pelaporan keuangannya menjadi tanggung jawab Perseroan.

Secara khusus, dari sisi akuntansi, telah evaluasi AP Maria Leckzinska dari KAP Mirawati Sensi Idris juga menujukkan oleh Laporan Keuangan Konsolidasian Perseroan untuk tahun buku 2024 tidak mencapaciti dengan kejuang kejuangan di Indonesia.

# Tinjauan atas Efektivitas Sistem Pengendalian Internal ACGS E.3.18. ACGS E.3.20.

Unit Audit Internal mengevaluasi tingkat kecukupan aktivitas pengendalian yang dijalkan oleh manajemen dalam upaya memitigasi risiko, lalu mencapaikan telah evaluasi tersebut dalam pentuk peringkat yang tercantum di setupan audit. Laporan tersebut kemudian disampaikan kepada Direksi, Dewan Komisaris, Komite Audit,serta manajemen terkait.

Berdasarkan haben evaluasi menyeluruh atas efektivitas fungsi pengendalian internal, yang mencakup fungsi audit internal, manajemen risiko, kepadahan,{serta pengendalian keuangan dan operasional, sepanjang tahun 2024 tidak ditemukan kelemahan signifikan dalam proses pengendalian keuangan dan operasional yang berdampak pada kinerja keuangan dan operasional Perseroan. Sistem pengendalian internal Perseroan dinilai telah berfungsi dengan@cukup baik dan efektif,meskipun masih terdapatagara area yang dapat terus ditingkatkan.

Untuk memastikan systemd pengendalian internal yang andal dan selaras dengan perkembangan bisnis Perseroan dan entitas anak, Perseroan berkomitmen untuk seksukan tinjauan berkala serta menyempurnakan systemd pengendalian internal yang telah diterapkan.

# Internal Control over Financial Reporting (ICFR)

The Company has a business control division which is responsible for the ICFR process in the Company. The ICFR scope of work is based on the framework for internal control, published by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) which consists of 5(five) components, i.e. control environment, risk assessment, control activities, information and communication systems, and monitoring.

The ICFR is carried out to ensure the reliability of financial information and the timeliness of interim and annual financial reports. The Company and its subsidiaries are required to comply with the ICFR requirements. The same applies to associated companies, joint operations, and joint ventures in which the Company is responsible for the accounting and financial reporting.

Specifically, in terms of accounting, the evaluation results of AP Maria Leckzinska of KAP Mirawati Sensi Idris also showed that the Company's Consolidated Financial Statements for the year 2024 were presented fairly, in all material respects, in accordance with Indonesian Financial Accounting Standards.

# Review of Internal Control System Effectiveness

ACGS.E.3.18 ACGS.E.3.20

The Internal Audit Unit evaluates the adequacy rate of control activities implemented by management to mitigate risks, then shows the evaluation result in the form of rate for each audit report. The aforesaid report is submitted to the Board of Directors, Board of Commissioners, the Audit Committee, and related management personnel later on.

Based on a comprehensive evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control functions, which consists of the internal audit function, the risk management function, compliance, as well as financial and operational controls, in 2024, there were no significant weaknesses in the financial and operational control processes that affect the financial and operational performance of the Company. The Company's internal control system has been carried out adequately and effectively, although there are still several areas that can be improved continuously.

To ensure a reliable and appropriate internal control system for the business development of the Company and its subsidiaries, the Company will periodically review and make improvements to the existing internal control system.

# Sistem Pelaporan Pelanggaran (WBS) [GRI-2-25-b] [GRI-2-26] [ACGS (B)C.1.3.]

WBS merupakan sarana komunikasi bagi para pemangku kepentingan untuk melaporkan dan/atau mengungkapkan adanya indikasi pelanggaran yang terjadi di dalam lingkungan Perseroan. Sistem ini dirancang untuk memberikan jalur yang aman bagi siapa pun untuk mencampaikan informasi(OPAL) pelanggaran, yang kemudian dapat segera ditindaklanjuti oleh pihak yang berwenang.

Indikasi pelanggaran yang dimaksud meliputi berbagai praktik yang tidak benar, ilegal, dan tidak etis, termasuk kecurangan, ketidakujuran, pelanggaran hukum, penggunaan Dana yang tidak benar, korupsi, suap dari pemasok/kontraktor/pelanggan/pihak ketiga lainnya, pelanggaran Kode Etik, penyalahgunaan wewenang, pelecehan seksual, dan segala pentuk pelanggaran lainnya yang bertentangan dengan prinsip-prinsip governansi korporat yang baik dan Kode Etik Perseroan.

Perseroan secara konsisten berupaya mendorong para pemangku kepentingan untuk terlibat telah dalam Perseroan melalui RUPS. Salah satunya adalah dengan mendorong para pemangku kepentingan untuk secara tidak langsung ikut mengawasi Perseroan dengan berpartisipasi untuk memberikan saran/ masukan, melaporkan indikasi pelanggaran, dan/atau menjadiakan keprihatinan kepada keluhan atas pelanggaran hak para pemangku kepentingan (jika ada) melalui WBS. WBS tersebut bagian integral dari program dan prosedur anti-korupsi dan penegakan etika bisnis yang difajalankan dalam Perseroan. [ACGS A.4.1.] [ACGS C.4.5.] [ACGS C.7.1.]

# Whistleblowing System (WBS) [GRI-2-25-b] [GRI-2-26]  
[AC6S(B)C.1.3.]

WBS is a communication tool for stakeholders to report and/or disclose indications of violations occurring within the Company's environment. This system is designed to provide a secure channel for anyone to report information regarding violations, which can be promptly followed up by the authorized parties.

The indications of violations referred include various improper, alleged illegal, and unethical practices, including fraud, dishonesty, violation of law, improper use of funds, corruption, accepting bribes from suppliers/contractors/customers/other third parties, violations of the Code of Conduct, abuse of power, sexual harassment, and any other forms of violations that contradict the principles of good governance and the Company's Code of Conducts.

The Company consistently seeks to encourage stakeholders to be engaged in the Company beyond the GMS. One way is to encourage stakeholders to indirectly participate in monitoring the Company by participating in providing suggestions/inputs, reporting indications of violations, and/or voicing concerns or complaints regarding violations of stakeholders' rights (if any) through the WBS. WBS has become an integral part of the anti-corruption program and procedure and enforcement of business ethics carried out within the Company. [ACGS A.4.1.] [ACGS C.4.5.] [ACGS C.7.1.]

# Sistem Pengelolaan Risiko [GRI 102-11]

Perseroan memahami telah dengan bisnis yang bervariasi, risiko yang dihadapiantu bisnis dapat berbeda dengan bisnis lainnya. Perseroan dan entitas tidak memiliki tim yang kompeten dan/atau tersertifikasi dalam melaksanan pengelolaan risiko terintegrasi untuk mengidentifikasi, menganalisis, dan mengelola risiko Perseroan secara menyeluruh.

Dengan berpedoman pada standar ISO 31000:2018 yang terdiri dari 3 elemen yaitu prinsip manajemen risiko yang didasarkan pada Komite Organisasi Sponsor Komisi Treadway (COSO), kerangka kerja manajemen risiko, dan proses manajemen risiko; Perseroan mencgabungkan berbagai aspek manajemen risiko ke dalam dapat kerangka kerja yang koheren, seesingga semuajenis risiko, baik yang terkait dengan operasional, keuangan, reputasi, dan kepadahan, dapat dikelola secara proaktif untuk meminimalkan dampak negatif yang mungkin timbul.

Kerangka kerja manajemen risiko Perseroan meliputi proses identifikasi, analisis, pengukuran, respons, pemantauan, dan pelaporan risiko yang berpotensi mempengaruhi pencapaian tujuan bisnis Perseroan.

Untuk memastikan bahwa Seluruh risiko dikelola sesuai dengan tingkat toleransi risiko yang telah ditetapkan, Perseroan mencapakan indicator risiko dan indicator kinerja utama sebagai alat pemantauan yang efektif. Penerapan ini diharapkan mendukung Perseroan dalam merespons ketidakpASTian yang timbul baik dari faktor internal maupun eksternal.

Direksi Perseroan menetapkan ekspektasi, mengawasi kerangka kerja manajemen risiko Perseroan, dan memantau risiko utama dengan makukutan penilaian risiko tahunan melalui analisis semua profil risiko dari setiap lini usaha strategis, menggabungkanya dalam tingkat korporasi, dan kemudian menentukan tindakan/ strategi yang sesuai.

Through the implementation of WBS, the Company expects to create a productive work environment, free from unethical practices. The Company expects to maintain a good reputation that can support the sustainability of business activities in the long term.

In 2024, the Company received several complaints through the WBS related to security reporting cases, discipline, violation of SOP, and potential fraud. Each complaint received has been handled seriously and by the provisions outlined in the Company's Regulation. The complaint handling process is conducted internally by the relevant unit, to ensure that each case is followed up appropriately, accurately, and fairly, and provides an effective solution. # Risk Management System [GRI102-11]

The Company realizes that with diverse businesses, the risks faced by one business may differ from those of another. The Company and its subsidiaries have competent and/or certified teams in implementing integrated risk management to identify, analyze, and manage the Company's risks comprehensively.

By adhering to the ISO 31000:2018 standard, which consists of three elements: risk management principles based on the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO), the risk management framework, and the risk management process; the Company integrates various aspects of risk management into a coherent framework, so that all types of risks, whether related to operations, finance, reputation, and compliance, can be proactively managed to minimize potential negative impacts.

The Company's risk management framework encompasses a comprehensive process of risk identification, analysis, measurement, response, monitoring, and reporting, all of which are essential to safeguarding the achievement of the Company's business objectives.

To ensure that all risks are managed in line with the established risk appetite, the Company implements key risk indicators and key performance indicators as effective monitoring tools. These indicators support the Company's ability to respond adequately to uncertainties arising from both internal and external environments.

The Company's Board of Directors sets expectations, oversees the Company's risk management framework, and monitors key risks by conducting annual risk assessments by analyzing all strategic business lines' risk profiles, consolidating them at the corporate level, and determining the appropriate response actions/strategy.

Proses manajemen risiko terdiri dari 5(lima) kegiatan utama:

# 1. Penetapan Ruang Lingkup, Konteks, dan Kriteria

Proses manajemen risiko diawali dengan menetapkan ruang lingkup, konteks, dan kriteria yang jelas dengan tujuan untuk menyesuaikan proses manajemen risiko, memungkinkan penilaian risiko yang efektif dan perlakuan risiko yang tepat.

Ruang lin gkup, konteks, dan kriteria yang sudah ditetapkan dokumunikasikan dengan jelas kepada manajer di semua tingkatan agar dapat dipahami dengan baik.

# 2. Penilaian Risiko

Pada tahap ini, risiko diidentifikasi, dianalisis, dan dievaluasi.

Semua pemilik risiko bertanggung jawab untuk mengidentifikasi risiko, kenda, ata hambatan yang dapat memengaruhi pencapaian tujuan Perseroan. Risiko-risiko ini kemudian dinilai berdasarkan tingkatannya dan difokuskan pada risiko utama (risiko kritis dan tinggi). Risiko utama akan dianalisis lebih lanjut dengan mencgunakan berbagai teknik penilaian risiko untuk mengarticulasikan attribut utamanya dan menetapkan materialitasnya.

# 3. Penanganan Risiko

Pada takap ini dilakukan pemilihan dan tenerapan opsi untuk mengatasi risiko.

Penanganan risiko melibatkan proses berulang, sebagai berikut:

- merumuskan dan memilih opsi penanganan risiko  
- merencanakan dan melaksanakan penanganan risiko

The risk management process consists of 5 (five) main activities:

# 1. Scope, Context, and Criteria Determination

The risk management process begins with establishing a clear scope, context, and criteria to adjust the risk management process, enabling effective risk assessment and appropriate risk treatment.

The scope, context, and criteria that have been determined are communicated clearly to managers at all levels so that they can be well understood.

# 2. Risk Assessment

At this stage, risks are identified, analyzed, and evaluated.

All risk owners responsible to identify the risks, constraints, or obstacles that may affect the achievement of the Company's goals. These risks are then graded based on their level and focused on key risks (critical and high risks). Key risks will be further analysed using various risk assessment techniques to articulate key attributes and determine their materiality.

# 3. Risk Treatment

At this stage, options are selected and implemented to mitigate risks.

Risk treatment involves an iterative process, as follows:

formulating and selecting risk treatment options  
planning and implementing risk treatment

menilai efektivitas penanganan risiko tersebut  
- memutusan apakah risiko yang tersisa dapat diterima, dan  
- jika tidak dapat diterima, melakukan penanganan lebih lanjut

Program mitigasi dirancang untuk menjadi risiko utama yang telah diidentifikasikan pada proses penilaian risiko. Strategi mitigasi dipilih dan dievaluasi berdasarkan analisis biaya-manfaat.

# 4. Peninjauan dan Pemantauan Risiko

Pada tahap ini, risiko ditinjau dan dipantau secara berkelanjutan dengan mempertimbangkan laju perubahan internal dan eksternal termasuk menyelaraskan rencana dengan sasan/target, risiko, dan mitigasi yang telah ditentukan.

# 5. Pelaporan

Pada tahap ini, dampak dari risiko dicatat dan dilaporkan di setiap unit bisnis dan fungsional. Informasi ini kemudian digabungkan lebih lanjut pada tingkatan grup untuk memastikan koordinasi yang efektif.

Perseroan juga menerapkan pendekatan model tiga lini untuk mengidentifikasi dan mengelola risiko.

- assessing the effectiveness of the risk treatment  
deciding whether the remaining risk is acceptable, and  
- if not acceptable, taking further treatment

Mitigation programs are designed to address the key risks identified in the risk assessment process. Mitigation strategies are selected and evaluated based on cost-benefit analysis.

# 4. Risk Review and Monitoring

At this stage, risks are reviewed and monitored on an ongoing basis, considering the pace of internal and external changes including aligning plans with the defined goals/targets, risks, and mitigation.

# 5. Reporting

At this stage, risk impacts are recorded and reported across each business and functional unit. This information is then further aggregated at the group level to ensure effective coordination.

The Company also applies the three-lines model approach to identify and manage risks.
